**31** (31) And whoever of you devoutly obeys All?h and His Messenger and does righteousness - We will give her her reward twice; and We have prepared for her a noble provision.

**32** (32) O wives of the Prophet, you are not like anyone among women. If you fear All?h, then do not be soft in speech [to men],[1195] lest he in whose heart is disease should covet, but speak with appropriate speech.

**33** (33) And abide in your houses and do not display yourselves as [was] the display of the former times of ignorance. And establish prayer and give zak?h and obey All?h and His Messenger. All?h intends only to remove from you the impurity [of sin], O people of the [Prophet's] household, and to purify you with [extensive] purification.

**34** (34) And remember what is recited in your houses of the verses of All?h and wisdom.[1196] Indeed, All?h is ever Subtle[1197] and Aware.

**35** (35) Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so, and the men who remember All?h often and the women who do so - for them All?h has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.

**36** (36) It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when All?h and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys All?h and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error.

**37** (37) And [remember, O Mu?ammad], when you said to the one on whom All?h bestowed favor and you bestowed favor,[1198] "Keep your wife and fear All?h," while you concealed within yourself that which All?h is to disclose.[1199] And you feared the people,[1200] while All?h has more right that you fear Him.[1201] So when Zayd had no longer any need for her, We married her to you in order that there not be upon the believers any discomfort [i.e., guilt] concerning the wives of their claimed [i.e., adopted] sons when they no longer have need of them. And ever is the command [i.e., decree] of All?h accomplished.

**38** (38) There is not to be upon the Prophet any discomfort concerning that which All?h has imposed upon him.[1202] [This is] the established way of All?h with those [prophets] who have passed on before. And ever is the command of All?h a destiny decreed.

**39** (39) [All?h praises] those who convey the messages of All?h[1203] and fear Him and do not fear anyone but All?h. And sufficient is All?h as Accountant.

**4** (4) All?h has not made for a man two hearts in his interior. And He has not made your wives whom you declare unlawful[1180] your mothers. And He has not made your claimed [i.e., adopted] sons your [true] sons. That is [merely] your saying by your mouths, but All?h says the truth, and He guides to the [right] way.

**40** (40) Mu?ammad is not the father of [any] one of your men, but [he is] the Messenger of All?h and seal [i.e., last] of the prophets. And ever is All?h, of all things, Knowing.

**41** (41) O you who have believed, remember All?h with much remembrance

**42** (42) And exalt Him morning and afternoon.

**43** (43) It is He who confers blessing upon you,[1204] and His angels [ask Him to do so] that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And ever is He, to the believers, Merciful.

**44** (44) Their greeting the Day they meet Him will be, "Peace." And He has prepared for them a noble reward.

**45** (45) O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner

**46** (46) And one who invites to All?h, by His permission, and an illuminating lamp.

**47** (47) And give good tidings to the believers that they will have from All?h great bounty.

**48** (48) And do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites and disregard their annoyance, and rely upon All?h. And sufficient is All?h as Disposer of affairs.

**49** (49) O you who have believed, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them [i.e., consummated the marriage], then there is not for you any waiting period to count concerning them. So provide for them and give them a gracious release.

**5** (5) Call them[1181] by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of All?h. But if you do not know their fathers - then they are [still] your brothers in religion and those entrusted to you. And there is no blame upon you for that in which you have erred but [only for] what your hearts intended. And ever is All?h Forgiving and Merciful.

**50** (50) O Prophet, indeed We have made lawful to you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation[1205] and those your right hand possesses from what All?h has returned to you [of captives] and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman if she gives herself to the Prophet [and] if the Prophet wishes to marry her; [this is] only for you, excluding the [other] believers. We certainly know what We have made obligatory upon them concerning their wives and those their right hands possess, [but this is for you] in order that there will be upon you no discomfort [i.e., difficulty]. And ever is All?h Forgiving and Merciful.

**51** (51) You, [O Mu?ammad], may put aside whom you will of them[1206] or take to yourself whom you will. And any that you desire of those [wives] from whom you had [temporarily] separated - there is no blame upon you [in returning her]. That is more suitable that they should be content and not grieve and that they should be satisfied with what you have given them - all of them. And All?h knows what is in your hearts. And ever is All?h Knowing and Forbearing.

**52** (52) Not lawful to you, [O Mu?ammad], are [any additional] women after [this], nor [is it] for you to exchange them for [other] wives, even if their beauty were to please you, except what your right hand possesses. And ever is All?h, over all things, an Observer.[1207]

**53** (53) O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet except when you are permitted for a meal, without awaiting its readiness. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for conversation. Indeed, that [behavior] was troubling the Prophet, and he is shy of [dismissing] you. But All?h is not shy of the truth. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not [conceivable or lawful] for you to harm the Messenger of All?h or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that would be in the sight of All?h an enormity.

**54** (54) Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, indeed All?h is ever, of all things, Knowing.

**55** (55) There is no blame upon them [i.e., women] concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or those their right hands possess [i.e., slaves].[1208] And fear All?h. Indeed All?h is ever, over all things, Witness.

**56** (56) Indeed, All?h confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so]. O you who have believed, ask [All?h to confer] blessing upon him and ask [All?h to grant him] peace.

**57** (57) Indeed, those who abuse All?h and His Messenger - All?h has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

**58** (58) And those who harm believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned [i.e., deserved] have certainly borne upon themselves a slander and manifest sin.

**59** (59) O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments.[1209] That is more suitable that they will be known[1210] and not be abused. And ever is All?h Forgiving and Merciful.[1211]

**6** (6) The Prophet is more worthy of the believers than themselves,[1182] and his wives are [in the position of] their mothers. And those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of All?h than the [other] believers and the emigrants, except that you may do to your close associates a kindness [through bequest]. That was in the Book[1183] inscribed.

**60** (60) If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease[1212] and those who spread rumors in al-Mad?nah do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little,

**61** (61) Accursed wherever they are found, [being] seized and massacred completely.

**62** (62) [This is] the established way of All?h with those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of All?h any change.

**63** (63) People ask you concerning the Hour. Say, "Knowledge of it is only with All?h. And what may make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near."

**64** (64) Indeed, All?h has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.

**65** (65) Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.

**66** (66) The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed All?h and obeyed the Messenger."

**67** (67) And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries,[1213] and they led us astray from the [right] way.

**68** (68) Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse."

**69** (69) O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then All?h cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of All?h, was distinguished.

**7** (7) And [mention, O Mu?ammad], when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a solemn covenant

**70** (70) O you who have believed, fear All?h and speak words of appropriate justice.

**71** (71) He will [then] amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys All?h and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.

**72** (72) Indeed, We offered the Trust[1214] to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man [undertook to] bear it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.[1215]

**73** (73) [It[1216] was] so that All?h may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the men and women who associate others with Him and that All?h may accept repentance from the believing men and believing women. And ever is All?h Forgiving and Merciful.

**8** (8) That He may question the truthful about their truth.[1184] And He has prepared for the disbelievers a painful punishment.

**9** (9) O you who have believed, remember the favor of All?h upon you when armies came to [attack] you and We sent upon them a wind and armies [of angels] you did not see. And ever is All?h, of what you do, Seeing.

title: Surah 034 - Sheba (Saba)
content:
**1** (1) [All] praise is [due] to All?h, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Aware.

**10** (10) And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made pliable for him iron,

**11** (11) [Commanding him], "Make full coats of mail and calculate [precisely] the links, and work [all of you] righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Seeing."

**12** (12) And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.

**13** (13) They made for him what he willed of elevated chambers,[1220] statues,[1221] bowls like reservoirs, and stationary kettles. [We said], "Work, O family of David, in gratitude." And few of My servants are grateful.

**14** (14) And when We decreed for him [i.e., Solomon] death, nothing indicated to them [i.e., the jinn] his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff.[1222] But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.[1223]

**15** (15) There was for [the tribe of] Saba� in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord."

**16** (16) But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam,[1224] and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.

**17** (17) [By] that We repaid them because they disbelieved. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?

**18** (18) And We placed between them and the cities which We had blessed[1225] [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey,[1226] [saying], "Travel between them by night or by day in safety."

**19** (19) But [insolently] they said, "Our Lord, lengthen the distance between our journeys," and wronged themselves, so We made them narrations[1227] and dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

**2** (2) He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

**20** (20) And Iblees had already confirmed through them[1228] his assumption,[1229] so they followed him, except for a party of believers.

**21** (21) And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is thereof in doubt. And your Lord, over all things, is Guardian.[1230]

**22** (22) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides All?h." They do not possess an atom's weight [of ability] in the heavens or on the earth, and they do not have therein any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.

**23** (23) And intercession does not benefit with Him except for one whom He permits. [And those wait] until, when terror is removed from their hearts,[1231] they will say [to one another], "What has your Lord said?" They will say, "The truth." And He is the Most High, the Grand.

**24** (24) Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "All?h. And indeed, we or you are either upon guidance or in clear error."

**25** (25) Say, "You will not be asked about what we committed, and we will not be asked about what you do."

**26** (26) Say, "Our Lord will bring us together; then He will judge between us in truth. And He is the Knowing Judge."[1232]

**27** (27) Say, "Show me those whom you have attached to Him as partners. No! Rather, He [alone] is All?h, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

**28** (28) And We have not sent you except comprehensively[1233] to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.

**29** (29) And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

**3** (3) But those who disbelieve say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say, "Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. [All?h is] the Knower of the unseen." Not absent from Him is an atom's weight[1218] within the heavens or within the earth or [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is in a clear register -

**30** (30) Say, "For you is the appointment of a Day [when] you will not remain thereafter an hour, nor will you precede [it]."

**31** (31) And those who disbelieve say, "We will never believe in this Qur�?n nor in that before it." But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting each others' words...[1234] Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If not for you, we would have been believers."

**32** (32) Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals."

**33** (33) Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in All?h and attribute to Him equals." But they will [all] confide regret when they see the punishment; and We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?

**34** (34) And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."

**35** (35) And they[1235] said, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."

**36** (36) Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."

**37** (37) And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but it is [by being] one who has believed and done righteousness. For them there will be the double reward for what they did, and they will be in the upper chambers [of Paradise], safe [and secure].

**38** (38) And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure[1236] - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

**39** (39) Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."

**4** (4) That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Those will have forgiveness and noble provision.

**40** (40) And [mention] the Day when He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"

**41** (41) They will say, "Exalted are You! You, [O All?h], are our benefactor excluding [i.e., not] them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them."

**42** (42) But today [i.e., the Day of Judgement] you do not hold for one another [the power of] benefit or harm, and We will say to those who wronged, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you used to deny."

**43** (43) And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, "This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping." And they say, "This is not except a lie invented." And those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic."

**44** (44) And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Mu?ammad], any warner.

**45** (45) And those before them denied, and they [i.e., the people of Makkah] have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But they [i.e., the former peoples] denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.

**46** (46) Say, "I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for All?h, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought." There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.

**47** (47) Say, "Whatever payment I might have asked of you - it is yours. My payment is only from All?h, and He is, over all things, Witness."

**48** (48) Say, "Indeed, my Lord projects the truth, Knower of the unseen."

**49** (49) Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."[1237]

**5** (5) But those who strive against Our verses [seeking] to cause failure[1219] - for them will be a painful punishment of foul nature.

**50** (50) Say, "If I should err, I would only err against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and near."

**51** (51) And if you could see[1238] when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.

**52** (52) And they will [then] say, "We believe in it!" But how for them will be the taking[1239] [of faith] from a place far away?[1240]

**53** (53) And they had already disbelieved in it before and would assault[1241] the unseen from a place far away.[1242]

**54** (54) And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire,[1243] as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting doubt [i.e., denial].

**6** (6) And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and it guides to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.

**7** (7) But those who disbelieve say, "Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you [that] when you have disintegrated in complete disintegration, you will [then] be [recreated] in a new creation?

**8** (8) Has he invented about All?h a lie or is there in him madness?" Rather, they who do not believe in the Hereafter will be in the punishment and [are in] extreme error.

**9** (9) Then, do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or [could] let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to All?h].

title: Surah 035 - Originator (Fatir)
content:
**1** (1) [All] praise is [due] to All?h, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, All?h is over all things competent.

**10** (10) Whoever desires honor [through power] - then to All?h belongs all honor.[1245] To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it.[1246] But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.

**11** (11) And All?h created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for All?h is easy.

**12** (12) And not alike are the two seas [i.e., bodies of water]. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

**13** (13) He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is All?h, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.

**14** (14) If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association.[1247] And none can inform you like [one] Aware [of all matters].

**15** (15) O mankind, you are those in need of All?h, while All?h is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

**16** (16) If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.

**17** (17) And that is for All?h not difficult.

**18** (18) And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to All?h is the [final] destination.

**19** (19) Not equal are the blind and the seeing,

**2** (2) Whatever All?h grants to people of mercy - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**20** (20) Nor are the darknesses and the light,

**21** (21) Nor are the shade and the heat,[1248]

**22** (22) And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, All?h causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.[1249]

**23** (23) You, [O Mu?ammad], are not but a warner.

**24** (24) Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.

**25** (25) And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.

**26** (26) Then I seized the ones who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

**27** (27) Do you not see that All?h sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.

**28** (28) And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear All?h, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, All?h is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.

**29** (29) Indeed, those who recite the Book of All?h and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a transaction [i.e., profit] that will never perish -

**3** (3) O mankind, remember the favor of All?h upon you. Is there any creator other than All?h who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?

**30** (30) That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.[1250]

**31** (31) And that which We have revealed to you, [O Mu?ammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed All?h, of His servants, is Aware and Seeing.

**32** (32) Then We caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants;[1251] and among them is he who wrongs himself [i.e., sins], and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of All?h. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.

**33** (33) [For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.

**34** (34) And they will say, "Praise to All?h, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -

**35** (35) He who has settled us in the home of duration [i.e., Paradise] out of His bounty. There touches us not in it any fatigue, and there touches us not in it weariness [of mind]."

**36** (36) And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them[1252] so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one.

**37** (37) And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us;[1253] we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.

**38** (38) Indeed, All?h is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

**39** (39) It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.

**4** (4) And if they deny you, [O Mu?ammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to All?h are returned [all] matters.

**40** (40) Say, "Have you considered[1254] your 'partners' whom you invoke besides All?h? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."[1255]

**41** (41) Indeed, All?h holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing[1256] and Forgiving.

**42** (42) And they swore by All?h their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion

**43** (43) [Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way [i.e., fate] of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way [i.e., established method] of All?h any change, and you will never find in the way of All?h[1257] any alteration.[1258]

**44** (44) Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But All?h is not to be caused failure [i.e., prevented] by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.

**45** (45) And if All?h were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon it [i.e., the earth] any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed All?h has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.

**5** (5) O mankind, indeed the promise of All?h is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about All?h by the Deceiver [i.e., Satan].

**6** (6) Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.

**7** (7) Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.

**8** (8) Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, All?h sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, All?h is Knowing of what they do.

**9** (9) And it is All?h who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.

title: Surah 036 - Ya Sin (Ya-Sin)
content:
**1** (1) Y?, Seen.[1260]

**10** (10) And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.

**11** (11) You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.

**12** (12) Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.

**13** (13) And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -

**14** (14) When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened [them] with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."

**15** (15) They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."

**16** (16) They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,

**17** (17) And we are not responsible except for clear notification."

**18** (18) They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful punishment."

**19** (19) They said, "Your omen [i.e., fate] is with yourselves. Is it[1262] because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."

**2** (2) By the wise[1261] Qur�?n,

**20** (20) And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.

**21** (21) Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.

**22** (22) And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?

**23** (23) Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?

**24** (24) Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.

**25** (25) Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."

**26** (26) It was said, "Enter Paradise."[1263] He said, "I wish my people could know

**27** (27) Of how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."

**28** (28) And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.

**29** (29) It was not but one shout,[1264] and immediately they were extinguished.

**3** (3) Indeed you, [O Mu?ammad], are from among the messengers,

**30** (30) How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.

**31** (31) Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them[1265] will not return?

**32** (32) And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.

**33** (33) And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.

**34** (34) And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -

**35** (35) That they may eat of His fruit.[1266] And their hands have not produced it,[1267] so will they not be grateful?

**36** (36) Exalted is He who created all pairs[1268] - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.

**37** (37) And a sign for them is the night. We remove[1269] from it the [light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.

**38** (38) And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

**39** (39) And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.

**4** (4) On a straight path.

**40** (40) It is not allowable [i.e., possible] for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.

**41** (41) And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers[1270] in a laden ship.

**42** (42) And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.

**43** (43) And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved

**44** (44) Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.

**45** (45) But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you;[1271] perhaps you will receive mercy..."[1272]

**46** (46) And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they are from it turning away.

**47** (47) And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which All?h has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Should we feed one whom, if All?h had willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error."

**48** (48) And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

**49** (49) They do not await except one blast[1273] which will seize them while they are disputing.

**5** (5) [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

**50** (50) And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.

**51** (51) And the Horn will be blown;[1274] and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.

**52** (52) They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."

**53** (53) It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.

**54** (54) So today [i.e., the Day of Judgement] no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.

**55** (55) Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -

**56** (56) They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.

**57** (57) For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]

**58** (58) [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.

**59** (59) [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.[1275]

**6** (6) That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.

**60** (60) Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -

**61** (61) And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.

**62** (62) And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?

**63** (63) This is the Hellfire which you were promised.

**64** (64) [Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."[1276]

**65** (65) That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.

**66** (66) And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?[1277]

**67** (67) And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.[1278]

**68** (68) And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation;[1279] so will they not understand?

**69** (69) And We did not give him [i.e., Prophet Mu?ammad (?)] knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur�?n

**7** (7) Already the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.

**70** (70) To warn whoever is alive[1280] and justify the word [i.e., decree] against the disbelievers.

**71** (71) Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands[1281] have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?

**72** (72) And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.

**73** (73) And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?

**74** (74) But they have taken besides All?h [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.

**75** (75) They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.[1282]

**76** (76) So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.

**77** (77) Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once[1283] he is a clear adversary?

**78** (78) And he presents for Us an example[1284] and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"

**79** (79) Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."

**8** (8) Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.

**80** (80) [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.

**81** (81) Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.

**82** (82) His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.

**83** (83) So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.

**9** (9) And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.

title: Surah 037 - Those who set the Ranks (As-Saffat)
content:
**1** (1) By those [angels] lined up in rows

**10** (10) Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].

**100** (100) My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."

**101** (101) So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

**102** (102) And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion,[1296] he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if All?h wills, of the steadfast."

**103** (103) And when they had both submitted[1297] and he put him down upon his forehead,

**104** (104) We called to him, "O Abraham,

**105** (105) You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

**106** (106) Indeed, this was the clear trial.

**107** (107) And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,[1298]

**108** (108) And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

**109** (109) "Peace upon Abraham."

**11** (11) Then inquire of them, [O Mu?ammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created them [i.e., men] from sticky clay.

**110** (110) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

**111** (111) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

**112** (112) And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.[1299]

**113** (113) And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself [i.e., sinner].

**114** (114) And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.

**115** (115) And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,

**116** (116) And We supported them so it was they who overcame.

**117** (117) And We gave them the explicit Scripture [i.e., the Torah],

**118** (118) And We guided them on the straight path.

**119** (119) And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:

**12** (12) But you wonder, while they mock,

**120** (120) "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."

**121** (121) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

**122** (122) Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.

**123** (123) And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,

**124** (124) When he said to his people, "Will you not fear All?h?

**125** (125) Do you call upon Ba?l[1300] and leave the best of creators -

**126** (126) All?h, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"

**127** (127) And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],

**128** (128) Except the chosen servants of All?h.

**129** (129) And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

**13** (13) And when they are reminded, they remember not.

**130** (130) "Peace upon Elias."[1301]

**131** (131) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

**132** (132) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

**133** (133) And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.

**134** (134) [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,

**135** (135) Except an old woman [i.e., his wife] among those who remained [with the evildoers].

**136** (136) Then We destroyed the others.

**137** (137) And indeed, you pass by them in the morning

**138** (138) And at night. Then will you not use reason?

**139** (139) And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.

**14** (14) And when they see a sign, they ridicule.

**140** (140) [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.

**141** (141) And he drew lots[1302] and was among the losers.

**142** (142) Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.[1303]

**143** (143) And had he not been of those who exalt All?h,

**144** (144) He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.[1304]

**145** (145) But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.

**146** (146) And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.[1305]

**147** (147) And We sent him[1306] to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.

**148** (148) And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.

**149** (149) So inquire of them, [O Mu?ammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?[1307]

**15** (15) And say, "This is not but obvious magic.

**150** (150) Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"

**151** (151) Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,

**152** (152) "All?h has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.

**153** (153) Has He chosen daughters over sons?

**154** (154) What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?

**155** (155) Then will you not be reminded?

**156** (156) Or do you have a clear authority?[1308]

**157** (157) Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.

**158** (158) And they have made [i.e., claimed] between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought [to punishment].

**159** (159) Exalted is All?h above what they describe,

**16** (16) When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

**160** (160) Except the chosen servants of All?h [who do not share in that sin].

**161** (161) So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,

**162** (162) You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him

**163** (163) Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.[1309]

**164** (164) [The angels say],[1310] "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.[1311]

**165** (165) And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].

**166** (166) And indeed, we are those who exalt All?h."

**167** (167) And indeed, they [i.e., the disbelievers] used to say,[1312]

**168** (168) "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,

**169** (169) We would have been the chosen servants of All?h."

**17** (17) And our forefathers [as well]?"

**170** (170) But they disbelieved in it,[1313] so they are going to know.

**171** (171) And Our word [i.e., decree] has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,

**172** (172) [That] indeed, they would be those given victory

**173** (173) And [that] indeed, Our soldiers [i.e., the believers] will be those who overcome.[1314]

**174** (174) So, [O Mu?ammad], leave them for a time.

**175** (175) And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.

**176** (176) Then for Our punishment are they impatient?

**177** (177) But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.

**178** (178) And leave them for a time.

**179** (179) And see, for they are going to see.

**18** (18) Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."

**180** (180) Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.

**181** (181) And peace upon the messengers.

**182** (182) And praise to All?h, Lord of the worlds.

**19** (19) It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.

**2** (2) And those who drive [the clouds]

**20** (20) They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."

**21** (21) [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."

**22** (22) [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds,[1289] and what they used to worship

**23** (23) Other than All?h, and guide them to the path of Hellfire

**24** (24) And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."

**25** (25) [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"

**26** (26) But they, that Day, are in surrender.

**27** (27) And they will approach one another asking [i.e., blaming] each other.

**28** (28) They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."[1290]

**29** (29) They [i.e., the oppressors] will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,

**3** (3) And those who recite the message,[1286]

**30** (30) And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.

**31** (31) So the word [i.e., decree] of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].

**32** (32) And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."

**33** (33) So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.

**34** (34) Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.

**35** (35) Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but All?h," were arrogant

**36** (36) And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"

**37** (37) Rather, he [i.e., the Prophet (?)] has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.

**38** (38) Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,

**39** (39) And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -

**4** (4) Indeed, your God is One,

**40** (40) But not the chosen servants of All?h.

**41** (41) Those will have a provision determined -

**42** (42) Fruits;[1291] and they will be honored

**43** (43) In gardens of pleasure

**44** (44) On thrones facing one another.

**45** (45) There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,

**46** (46) White and delicious to the drinkers;

**47** (47) No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.

**48** (48) And with them will be women limiting [their] glances,[1292] with large, [beautiful] eyes,

**49** (49) As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.

**5** (5) Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.[1287]

**50** (50) And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

**51** (51) A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth].

**52** (52) Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe

**53** (53) That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"

**54** (54) He will say,[1293] "Would you [care to] look?"

**55** (55) And he will look and see him[1294] in the midst of the Hellfire.

**56** (56) He will say, "By All?h, you almost ruined me.

**57** (57) If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].

**58** (58) Then, are we not to die

**59** (59) Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"

**6** (6) Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars

**60** (60) Indeed, this is the great attainment.

**61** (61) For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.

**62** (62) Is that [i.e., Paradise] a better accommodation or the tree of zaqq?m?

**63** (63) Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.

**64** (64) Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,

**65** (65) Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.

**66** (66) And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.

**67** (67) Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.

**68** (68) Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.

**69** (69) Indeed they found their fathers astray.

**7** (7) And as protection against every rebellious devil

**70** (70) So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.

**71** (71) And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,

**72** (72) And We had already sent among them warners.

**73** (73) Then look how was the end of those who were warned -

**74** (74) But not the chosen servants of All?h.

**75** (75) And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.

**76** (76) And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.

**77** (77) And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]

**78** (78) And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

**79** (79) "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."

**8** (8) [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,[1288]

**80** (80) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

**81** (81) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

**82** (82) Then We drowned the others [i.e., disbelievers].

**83** (83) And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,

**84** (84) When he came to his Lord with a sound heart

**85** (85) [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?

**86** (86) Is it falsehood [as] gods other than All?h you desire?

**87** (87) Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"

**88** (88) And he cast a look at the stars

**89** (89) And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."

**9** (9) Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,

**90** (90) So they turned away from him, departing.

**91** (91) Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?[1295]

**92** (92) What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"

**93** (93) And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.

**94** (94) Then they [i.e., the people] came toward him, hastening.

**95** (95) He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,

**96** (96) While All?h created you and that which you do?"

**97** (97) They said, "Construct for him a structure [i.e., furnace] and throw him into the burning fire."

**98** (98) And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the most debased.

**99** (99) And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.

title: Surah 038 - The Letter "Saad" (Sad)
content:
**1** (1) ??d.[1316] By the Qur�?n containing reminder...[1317]

**10** (10) Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.[1321]

**11** (11) [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].

**12** (12) The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] ?Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,[1322]

**13** (13) And [the tribe of] Tham?d and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket [i.e., people of Madyan]. Those are the companies.[1323]

**14** (14) Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.

**15** (15) And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.[1324]

**16** (16) And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account."

**17** (17) Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to All?h].

**18** (18) Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [All?h] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.

**19** (19) And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].

**2** (2) But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.

**20** (20) And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.

**21** (21) And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -

**22** (22) When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.

**23** (23) Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."

**24** (24) [David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord[1325] and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to All?h].

**25** (25) So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

**26** (26) [We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of All?h." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of All?h will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.

**27** (27) And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.

**28** (28) Or should We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear All?h like the wicked?

**29** (29) [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Mu?ammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.

**3** (3) How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.

**30** (30) And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to All?h].

**31** (31) [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.

**32** (32) And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until it [i.e., the sun] disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."

**33** (33) [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking[1326] [their] legs and necks.

**34** (34) And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body;[1327] then he returned.[1328]

**35** (35) He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."

**36** (36) So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,

**37** (37) And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver

**38** (38) And others bound together in irons.

**39** (39) [We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."

**4** (4) And they wonder that there has come to them a warner [i.e., Prophet Mu?ammad (?)] from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.

**40** (40) And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

**41** (41) And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."

**42** (42) [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for a] cool bath and drink."

**43** (43) And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

**44** (44) [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath."[1329] Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to All?h].

**45** (45) And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.

**46** (46) Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].

**47** (47) And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.

**48** (48) And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.

**49** (49) This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return -

**5** (5) Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."

**50** (50) Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.

**51** (51) Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

**52** (52) And with them will be women limiting [their] glances[1330] and of equal age.

**53** (53) This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.

**54** (54) Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.

**55** (55) This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -

**56** (56) Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.

**57** (57) This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.

**58** (58) And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.

**59** (59) [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."

**6** (6) And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.[1318]

**60** (60) They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."

**61** (61) They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."

**62** (62) And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?[1331]

**63** (63) Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"

**64** (64) Indeed, that is truth [i.e., reality] - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

**65** (65) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except All?h, the One, the Prevailing,[1332]

**66** (66) Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might,[1333] the Perpetual Forgiver."[1334]

**67** (67) Say, "It is great news

**68** (68) From which you turn away.

**69** (69) I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

**7** (7) We have not heard of this in the latest religion.[1319] This is not but a fabrication.

**70** (70) It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."

**71** (71) [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.

**72** (72) So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,[1335] then fall down to him in prostration."

**73** (73) So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

**74** (74) Except Iblees;[1336] he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

**75** (75) [All?h] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands?[1337] Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"

**76** (76) He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

**77** (77) [All?h] said, "Then get out of it [i.e., Paradise], for indeed, you are expelled.

**78** (78) And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."

**79** (79) He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

**8** (8) Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

**80** (80) [All?h] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

**81** (81) Until the Day of the time well-known."

**82** (82) [Iblees] said, "By Your might, I will surely mislead them all

**83** (83) Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

**84** (84) [All?h] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -

**85** (85) [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."

**86** (86) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "I do not ask you for it [i.e., the Qur�?n] any payment, and I am not of the pretentious.

**87** (87) It is but a reminder to the worlds.

**88** (88) And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."

**9** (9) Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?[1320]

title: Surah 039 - The Troops (Az-Zumar)
content:
**1** (1) The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur�?n] is from All?h, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**10** (10) Say,[1345] "O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of All?h is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account [i.e., limit]."

**11** (11) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to worship All?h, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

**12** (12) And I have been commanded to be the first [among you] of the Muslims."

**13** (13) Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

**14** (14) Say, "All?h [alone] do I worship, sincere to Him in my religion,

**15** (15) So worship what you will besides Him." Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."

**16** (16) They will have canopies [i.e., layers] of fire above them and below them, canopies. By that All?h threatens [i.e., warns] His servants. O My servants, then fear Me.

**17** (17) But those who have avoided ??gh?t,[1346] lest they worship it, and turned back to All?h - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings to My servants

**18** (18) Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones All?h has guided, and those are people of understanding.

**19** (19) Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?

**2** (2) Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book, [O Mu?ammad], in truth. So worship All?h, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

**20** (20) But those who have feared their Lord - for them are chambers,[1347] above them chambers built high, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of All?h. All?h does not fail in [His] promise.

**21** (21) Do you not see that All?h sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth; then He produces thereby crops of varying colors; then they dry and you see them turned yellow; then He makes them [scattered] debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.

**22** (22) So is one whose breast All?h has expanded to [accept] Isl?m and he is upon [i.e., guided by] a light from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects it]? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of All?h. Those are in manifest error.

**23** (23) All?h has sent down the best statement: a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance [i.e., mention] of All?h. That is the guidance of All?h by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom All?h sends astray - for him there is no guide.

**24** (24) Then is he who will shield with his face[1348] the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Taste what you used to earn."

**25** (25) Those before them denied, and punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive.

**26** (26) So All?h made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

**27** (27) And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur�?n from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.

**28** (28) [It is] an Arabic Qur�?n, without any deviance[1349] that they might become righteous.[1350]

**29** (29) All?h presents an example: a man [i.e., slave] owned by quarreling partners and another belonging exclusively to one man - are they equal in comparison? Praise be to All?h! But most of them do not know.

**3** (3) Unquestionably, for All?h is the pure religion.[1339] And those who take protectors besides Him [say], "We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to All?h in position." Indeed, All?h will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, All?h does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disbeliever.

**30** (30) Indeed, you are to die, and indeed, they are to die.

**31** (31) Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.

**32** (32) So who is more unjust than one who lies about All?h and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?

**33** (33) And the one who has brought the truth [i.e., the Prophet (?)] and [they who] believed in it - those are the righteous.

**34** (34) They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good -

**35** (35) That All?h may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.

**36** (36) Is not All?h sufficient for His Servant [i.e., Prophet Mu?ammad (?)]? And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him. And whoever All?h leaves astray - for him there is no guide.

**37** (37) And whoever All?h guides - for him there is no misleader. Is not All?h Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?

**38** (38) And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "All?h." Say, "Then have you considered[1351] what you invoke besides All?h? If All?h intended me harm, are they removers of His harm; or if He intended me mercy, are they withholders of His mercy?" Say, "Sufficient for me is All?h; upon Him [alone] rely the [wise] reliers."

**39** (39) Say, "O my people, work according to your position, [for] indeed, I am working; and you are going to know

**4** (4) If All?h had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is All?h, the One, the Prevailing.[1340]

**40** (40) To whom will come a torment disgracing him and on whom will descend an enduring punishment."

**41** (41) Indeed, We sent down to you the Book for the people in truth. So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager [i.e., authority] over them.

**42** (42) All?h takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

**43** (43) Or have they taken other than All?h as intercessors? Say, "Even though they do not possess [power over] anything, nor do they reason?"

**44** (44) Say, "To All?h belongs [the right to allow] intercession entirely. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."

**45** (45) And when All?h is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.

**46** (46) Say, "O All?h, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between your servants concerning that over which they used to differ."

**47** (47) And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby from the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from All?h that which they had not taken into account.[1352]

**48** (48) And there will appear to them the evils they had earned, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

**49** (49) And when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.

**5** (5) He created the heavens and earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.[1341]

**50** (50) Those before them had already said it, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

**51** (51) And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them. And those who have wronged of these [people] will be struck [i.e., afflicted] by the evil consequences of what they earned; and they will not cause failure.[1353]

**52** (52) Do they not know that All?h extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

**53** (53) Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of All?h. Indeed, All?h forgives all sins.[1354] Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

**54** (54) And return [in repentance] to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be helped.

**55** (55) And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord [i.e., the Qur�?n] before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive,

**56** (56) Lest a soul should say,[1355] "Oh, [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to All?h and that I was among the mockers."

**57** (57) Or [lest] it say, "If only All?h had guided me, I would have been among the righteous."

**58** (58) Or [lest] it say when it sees the punishment, "If only I had another turn[1356] so I could be among the doers of good."

**59** (59) But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.

**6** (6) He created you from one soul. Then He made from it its mate, and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates.[1342] He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses.[1343] That is All?h, your Lord; to Him belongs dominion. There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?

**60** (60) And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about All?h [with] their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?

**61** (61) And All?h will save those who feared Him by their attainment;[1357] no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

**62** (62) All?h is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.

**63** (63) To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And they who disbelieve in the verses of All?h - it is those who are the losers.

**64** (64) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Is it other than All?h that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"

**65** (65) And it was already revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with All?h, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers.

**66** (66) Rather, worship [only] All?h and be among the grateful.

**67** (67) They have not appraised All?h with true appraisal,[1358] while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip[1359] on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand.[1360] Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

**68** (68) And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom All?h wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.

**69** (69) And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.

**7** (7) If you disbelieve - indeed, All?h is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves [i.e., likes] it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

**70** (70) And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing[1361] of what they do.

**71** (71) And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word [i.e., decree] of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers."

**72** (72) [To them] it will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

**73** (73) But those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it while its gates have been opened and its keepers say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally therein," [they will enter].[1362]

**74** (74) And they will say, "Praise to All?h, who has fulfilled for us His promise and made us inherit the earth [so] we may settle in Paradise wherever we will. And excellent is the reward of [righteous] workers."

**75** (75) And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [All?h] with praise of their Lord. And it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said, "[All] praise to All?h, Lord of the worlds."

**8** (8) And when adversity touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him [alone]; then when He bestows on him a favor from Himself, he forgets Him whom he called upon before,[1344] and he attributes to All?h equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."

**9** (9) Is one who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing [in prayer], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, [like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.

title: Surah 040 - The Forgiver (Ghafir)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.[1364]

**10** (10) Indeed, those who disbelieve will be addressed, "The hatred of All?h for you was [even] greater than your hatred of yourselves [this Day in Hell] when you were invited to faith, but you disbelieved [i.e., refused]."

**11** (11) They will say, "Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have confessed our sins. So is there to an exit any way?"

**12** (12) [They will be told], "That is because, when All?h was called upon alone, you disbelieved; but if others were associated with Him, you believed. So the judgement is with All?h, the Most High, the Grand."

**13** (13) It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you from the sky, provision. But none will remember except he who turns back [in repentance].

**14** (14) So invoke All?h, [being] sincere to Him in religion, although the disbelievers dislike it.

**15** (15) [He is] the Exalted above [all] degrees, Owner of the Throne; He places the inspiration of His command [i.e., revelation] upon whom He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Meeting.

**16** (16) The Day they come forth nothing concerning them will be concealed from All?h. To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day? To All?h, the One, the Prevailing.[1365]

**17** (17) This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today! Indeed, All?h is swift in account.

**18** (18) And warn them, [O Mu?ammad], of the Approaching Day, when hearts are at the throats, filled [with distress]. For the wrongdoers there will be no devoted friend and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.

**19** (19) He knows that which deceives the eyes and what the breasts conceal.

**2** (2) The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur�?n] is from All?h, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing,

**20** (20) And All?h judges with truth, while those they invoke[1366] besides Him judge not with anything. Indeed, All?h - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

**21** (21) Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those who were before them? They were greater than them in strength and in impression on the land, but All?h seized them for their sins. And they had not from All?h any protector.

**22** (22) That was because their messengers were coming to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so All?h seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in punishment.

**23** (23) And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority[1367]
