**24** (24) To Pharaoh, H?m?n and Q?r?n, but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."

**25** (25) And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and keep their women alive." But the plan of the disbelievers is not except in error.

**26** (26) And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption[1368] in the land."

**27** (27) But Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."

**28** (28) And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is All?h' while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, All?h does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.

**29** (29) O my people, sovereignty is yours today, [your being] dominant in the land. But who would protect us from the punishment of All?h if it came to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."

**3** (3) The forgiver of sin, acceptor of repentance, severe in punishment, owner of abundance. There is no deity except Him; to Him is the destination.

**30** (30) And he who believed said, "O my people, indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies[1369] -

**31** (31) Like the custom of the people of Noah and of ?Aad and Tham?d and those after them. And All?h wants no injustice for [His] servants.

**32** (32) And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling[1370] -

**33** (33) The Day you will turn your backs fleeing; there is not for you from All?h any protector. And whoever All?h sends astray - there is not for him any guide.

**34** (34) And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs, but you remained in doubt of that which he brought to you, until when he died, you said, 'Never will All?h send a messenger after him.' Thus does All?h leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic."

**35** (35) Those who dispute concerning the signs of All?h without an authority[1371] having come to them - great is hatred [of them] in the sight of All?h and in the sight of those who have believed. Thus does All?h seal over every heart [belonging to] an arrogant tyrant.

**36** (36) And Pharaoh said, "O H?m?n, construct for me a tower that I might reach the ways[1372] -

**37** (37) The ways into the heavens - so that I may look at the deity of Moses; but indeed, I think he is a liar." And thus was made attractive to Pharaoh the evil of his deed, and he was averted from the [right] way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin.

**38** (38) And he who believed said, "O my people, follow me; I will guide you to the way of right conduct.

**39** (39) O my people, this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of [permanent] settlement.

**4** (4) No one disputes concerning the signs of All?h except those who disbelieve, so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.

**40** (40) Whoever does an evil deed will not be recompensed except by the like thereof; but whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - those will enter Paradise, being given provision therein without account.

**41** (41) And O my people, how is it that I invite you to salvation while you invite me to the Fire?

**42** (42) You invite me to disbelieve in All?h and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, and I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.[1373]

**43** (43) Assuredly, that to which you invite me has no [response to a] supplication in this world or in the Hereafter; and indeed, our return is to All?h, and indeed, the transgressors will be companions of the Fire.

**44** (44) And you will remember what I [now] say to you, and I entrust my affair to All?h. Indeed, All?h is Seeing of [His] servants."

**45** (45) So All?h protected him from the evils they plotted, and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst of punishment -

**46** (46) The Fire; they are exposed to it morning and evening.[1374] And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said], "Make the people of Pharaoh enter the severest punishment."

**47** (47) And [mention] when they will argue within the Fire, and the weak will say to those who had been arrogant, "Indeed, we were [only] your followers, so will you relieve us of a share of the Fire?"

**48** (48) Those who had been arrogant will say, "Indeed, all [of us] are in it. Indeed, All?h has judged between the servants."

**49** (49) And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Supplicate your Lord to lighten for us a day from the punishment."

**5** (5) The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

**50** (50) They will say, "Did there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes." They will reply, "Then supplicate [yourselves], but the supplication of the disbelievers is not except in error [i.e., futility]."

**51** (51) Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand -

**52** (52) The Day their excuse will not benefit the wrongdoers, and they will have the curse, and they will have the worst home [i.e., Hell].

**53** (53) And We had certainly given Moses guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture

**54** (54) As guidance and a reminder for those of understanding.

**55** (55) So be patient, [O Mu?ammad]. Indeed, the promise of All?h is truth. And ask forgiveness for your sin[1375] and exalt [All?h] with praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning.

**56** (56) Indeed, those who dispute concerning the signs of All?h without [any] evidence having come to them - there is not within their breasts except pride, [the extent of] which they cannot reach. So seek refuge in All?h. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.

**57** (57) The creation of the heavens and earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people do not know.

**58** (58) And not equal are the blind and the seeing, nor are those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little do you remember.

**59** (59) Indeed, the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - but most of the people do not believe.

**6** (6) And thus has the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord come into effect upon those who disbelieved that they are companions of the Fire.

**60** (60) And your Lord says, "Call upon Me; I will respond to you." Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell [rendered] contemptible.

**61** (61) It is All?h who made for you the night that you may rest therein and the day giving sight.[1376] Indeed, All?h is the possessor of bounty for the people, but most of them are not grateful.

**62** (62) That is All?h, your Lord, Creator of all things; there is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?

**63** (63) Thus were those [before you] deluded who were rejecting the signs of All?h.

**64** (64) It is All?h who made for you the earth a place of settlement and the sky a structure [i.e., ceiling] and formed you and perfected your forms and provided you with good things. That is All?h, your Lord; then blessed is All?h, Lord of the worlds.

**65** (65) He is the Ever-Living;[1377] there is no deity except Him, so call upon Him, [being] sincere to Him in religion. [All] praise is [due] to All?h, Lord of the worlds.

**66** (66) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides All?h once the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

**67** (67) It is He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot; then He brings you out as a child; then [He develops you] that you reach your [time of] maturity, then [further] that you become elders. And among you is he who is taken in death before [that], so that you reach a specified term;[1378] and perhaps you will use reason.

**68** (68) He it is who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a matter, He but says to it, "Be," and it is.

**69** (69) Do you not consider those who dispute concerning the signs of All?h - how are they averted?

**7** (7) Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [All?h] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.

**70** (70) Those who deny the Book [i.e., the Qur�?n] and that with which We sent Our messengers - they are going to know,

**71** (71) When the shackles are around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged

**72** (72) In boiling water; then in the Fire they will be filled [with flame].

**73** (73) Then it will be said to them, "Where is that which you used to associate [with Him in worship]

**74** (74) Other than All?h?" They will say, "They have departed from us; rather, we did not used to invoke previously anything." Thus does All?h put astray the disbelievers.

**75** (75) [The angels will say], "That was because you used to exult upon the earth without right and you used to behave insolently.

**76** (76) Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

**77** (77) So be patient, [O Mu?ammad]; indeed, the promise of All?h is truth. And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We take you in death, it is to Us they will be returned.

**78** (78) And We have already sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of All?h. So when the command of All?h comes, it will be concluded [i.e., judged] in truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].

**79** (79) It is All?h who made for you the grazing animals upon which you ride, and some of them you eat.

**8** (8) Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their forefathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**80** (80) And for you therein are [other] benefits and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts;[1379] and upon them and upon ships you are carried.

**81** (81) And He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of All?h do you deny?

**82** (82) Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than themselves and greater in strength and in impression on the land, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

**83** (83) And when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they [merely] rejoiced in what they had of knowledge, but they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

**84** (84) And when they saw Our punishment, they said, "We believe in All?h alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him."

**85** (85) But never did their faith benefit them once they saw Our punishment. [It is] the established way of All?h which has preceded among His servants. And the disbelievers thereupon lost [all].

**9** (9) And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment."

title: Surah 041 - Explained in Detail (Fussilat)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.[1381]

**10** (10) And He placed on it [i.e., the earth] firmly set mountains over its surface, and He blessed it and determined therein its [creatures'] sustenance in four days without distinction[1384] - for [the information of] those who ask.

**11** (11) Then He directed Himself[1385] to the heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come [into being],[1386] willingly or by compulsion." They said, "We have come willingly."

**12** (12) And He completed them as seven heavens within two days and inspired [i.e., made known] in each heaven its command. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars, for beauty] and as protection.[1387] That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

**13** (13) But if they turn away, then say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] ?Aad and Tham?d.

**14** (14) [That occurred] when the messengers had come to them before them and after them, [saying], "Worship not except All?h." They said, "If our Lord had willed,[1388] He would have sent down the angels, so indeed we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers."

**15** (15) As for ?Aad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, "Who is greater than us in strength?" Did they not consider that All?h who created them was greater than them in strength? But they were rejecting Our signs.

**16** (16) So We sent upon them a screaming wind during days of misfortune to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life; but the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgracing, and they will not be helped.

**17** (17) And as for Tham?d, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance, so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them for what they used to earn.

**18** (18) And We saved those who believed and used to fear All?h.

**19** (19) And [mention, O Mu?ammad], the Day when the enemies of All?h will be gathered to the Fire while they are [driven], assembled in rows,

**2** (2) [This is] a revelation from the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful -

**20** (20) Until, when they reach it, their hearing and their eyes and their skins will testify against them of what they used to do.

**21** (21) And they will say to their skins, "Why have you testified against us?" They will say, "We were made to speak by All?h, who has made everything speak; and He created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.

**22** (22) And you were not covering [i.e., protecting] yourselves,[1389] lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you assumed that All?h does not know much of what you do.

**23** (23) And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers."

**24** (24) So [even] if they are patient, the Fire is a residence for them; and if they ask to appease [All?h], they will not be of those who are allowed to appease.

**25** (25) And We appointed for them companions[1390] who made attractive to them what was before them and what was behind them [of sin], and the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon them among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.

**26** (26) And those who disbelieve say, "Do not listen to this Qur�?n and speak noisily[1391] during [the recitation of] it that perhaps you will overcome."

**27** (27) But We will surely cause those who disbelieve to taste a severe punishment, and We will surely recompense them for the worst of what they had been doing.

**28** (28) That is the recompense of the enemies of All?h - the Fire. For them therein is the home of eternity as recompense for what they, of Our verses, were rejecting.

**29** (29) And those who disbelieved will [then] say, "Our Lord, show us those who misled us of the jinn and men [so] we may put them under our feet[1392] that they will be among the lowest."

**3** (3) A Book whose verses have been detailed, an Arabic Qur�?n[1382] for a people who know,

**30** (30) Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is All?h" and then remained on a right course - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], "Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.

**31** (31) We [angels] were your allies in worldly life and [are so] in the Hereafter. And you will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you request [or wish]

**32** (32) As accommodation from a [Lord who is] Forgiving and Merciful."

**33** (33) And who is better in speech than one who invites to All?h and does righteousness and says, "Indeed, I am of the Muslims."

**34** (34) And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon, the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.

**35** (35) But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].

**36** (36) And if there comes to you from Satan an evil suggestion, then seek refuge in All?h. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

**37** (37) And of His signs are the night and day and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon, but prostrate to All?h, who created them, if it should be Him that you worship.[1393]

**38** (38) But if they are arrogant - then those who are near your Lord [i.e., the angels] exalt Him by night and by day, and they do not become weary.

**39** (39) And of His signs is that you see the earth stilled, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and grows. Indeed, He who has given it life is the Giver of Life to the dead. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

**4** (4) As a giver of good tidings and a warner; but most of them turn away, so they do not hear.

**40** (40) Indeed, those who inject deviation into Our verses[1394] are not concealed from Us. So, is he who is cast into the Fire better or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

**41** (41) Indeed, those who disbelieve in the message [i.e., the Qur�?n][1395] after it has come to them...[1396] And indeed, it is a mighty[1397] Book.

**42** (42) Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it; [it is] a revelation from a [Lord who is] Wise and Praiseworthy.

**43** (43) Nothing is said to you, [O Mu?ammad], except what was already said to the messengers before you. Indeed, your Lord is a possessor of forgiveness and a possessor of painful penalty.

**44** (44) And if We had made it a foreign [i.e., non-Arabic] Qur�?n, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail [in our language]? Is it a foreign [recitation] and an Arab [messenger]?" Say, "It is, for those who believe, a guidance and cure." And those who do not believe - in their ears is deafness, and it is upon them blindness. Those are being called from a distant place.[1398]

**45** (45) And We had already given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement.[1399] And if not for a word [i.e., decree][1400] that preceded from your Lord, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning it [i.e., the Qur�?n], in disquieting doubt.

**46** (46) Whoever does righteousness - it is for his [own] soul; and whoever does evil [does so] against it. And your Lord is not ever unjust to [His] servants.

**47** (47) To Him [alone] is attributed knowledge of the Hour. And fruits emerge not from their coverings nor does a female conceive or give birth except with His knowledge. And the Day He will call to them, "Where are My 'partners'?" they will say, "We announce to You that there is [no longer] among us any witness [to that]."

**48** (48) And lost from them will be those they were invoking before, and they will be certain that they have no place of escape.

**49** (49) Man is not weary of supplication for good [things], but if evil touches him, he is hopeless and despairing.

**5** (5) And they say, "Our hearts are within coverings [i.e., screened] from that to which you invite us, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a partition, so work;[1383] indeed, we are working."

**50** (50) And if We let him taste mercy from Us after an adversity which has touched him, he will surely say, "This is [due] to me,[1401] and I do not think the Hour will occur; and [even] if I should be returned to my Lord, indeed, for me there will be with Him the best." But We will surely inform those who disbelieved about what they did, and We will surely make them taste a massive punishment.

**51** (51) And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.

**52** (52) Say, "Have you considered: if it [i.e., the Qur�?n] is from All?h and you disbelieved in it, who would be more astray than one who is in extreme dissension?"

**53** (53) We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth.[1402] But is it not sufficient concerning your Lord that He is, over all things, a Witness?[1403]

**54** (54) Unquestionably, they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord. Unquestionably He is, of all things, encompassing.

**6** (6) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "I am only a man like you to whom it has been revealed that your god is but one God; so take a straight course to Him and seek His forgiveness." And woe to those who associate others with All?h �

**7** (7) Those who do not give zak?h, and in the Hereafter they are disbelievers.

**8** (8) Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them is a reward uninterrupted.

**9** (9) Say, "Do you indeed disbelieve in He who created the earth in two days and attribute to Him equals? That is the Lord of the worlds."

title: Surah 042 - The Consultation (Ash-Shuraa)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.

**10** (10) And in anything over which you disagree - its ruling is [to be referred] to All?h. [Say], "That is All?h, my Lord; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back."[1410]

**11** (11) [He is] Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you from yourselves, mates, and among the cattle, mates; He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like unto Him,[1411] and He is the Hearing, the Seeing.[1412]

**12** (12) To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is, of all things, Knowing.

**13** (13) He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Mu?ammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with All?h is that to which you invite them. All?h chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].

**14** (14) And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And if not for a word[1413] that preceded from your Lord [postponing the penalty] until a specified time, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are, concerning it, in disquieting doubt.

**15** (15) So to that [religion of All?h] invite, [O Mu?ammad],[1414] and remain on a right course as you are commanded and do not follow their inclinations but say, "I have believed in what All?h has revealed of scripture [i.e., the Qur�?n], and I have been commanded to do justice among you. All?h is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds, and for you your deeds.[1415] There is no [need for] argument between us and you.[1416] All?h will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination."

**16** (16) And those who argue concerning All?h after He has been responded to[1417] - their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them is [His] wrath, and for them is a severe punishment.

**17** (17) It is All?h who has sent down the Book in truth and [also] the balance [i.e., justice]. And what will make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near.

**18** (18) Those who do not believe in it are impatient for it,[1418] but those who believe are fearful of it and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute concerning the Hour are in extreme error.

**19** (19) All?h is Subtle[1419] with His servants; He gives provision to whom He wills. And He is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.

**2** (2) ?Ayn, Seen, Q?f.[1405]

**20** (20) Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest [i.e., reward]. And whoever desires the harvest [i.e., benefits] of this world - We give him thereof, but there is not for him in the Hereafter any share.

**21** (21) Or have they partners [i.e., other deities] who have ordained for them a religion to which All?h has not consented? But if not for the decisive word,[1420] it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.

**22** (22) You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, and it will [certainly] befall them. And those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in lush regions of the gardens [in Paradise] having whatever they will in the presence of their Lord. That is what is the great bounty.

**23** (23) It is that of which All?h gives good tidings to His servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say, [O Mu?ammad], "I do not ask you for it [i.e., this message] any payment [but] only good will through [i.e., due to] kinship." And whoever commits a good deed - We will increase for him good therein. Indeed, All?h is Forgiving and Appreciative.[1421]

**24** (24) Or do they say, "He has invented about All?h a lie"? But if All?h willed, He could seal over your heart.[1422] And All?h eliminates falsehood and establishes the truth by His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

**25** (25) And it is He who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons misdeeds, and He knows what you do.

**26** (26) And He answers [the supplication of] those who have believed and done righteous deeds and increases [for] them from His bounty. But the disbelievers will have a severe punishment.

**27** (27) And if All?h had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed He is, of His servants, Aware and Seeing.

**28** (28) And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.

**29** (29) And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and what He has dispersed throughout them of creatures. And He, for gathering them when He wills, is competent.

**3** (3) Thus has He revealed to you, [O Mu?ammad], and to those before you - All?h, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**30** (30) And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much.

**31** (31) And you will not cause failure [to All?h][1423] upon the earth. And you have not besides All?h any protector or helper.

**32** (32) And of His signs are the ships in the sea, like mountains.

**33** (33) If He willed, He could still the wind, and they would remain motionless on its surface. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

**34** (34) Or He could destroy them[1424] for what they earned; but He pardons much.

**35** (35) And [that is so] those who dispute concerning Our signs may know that for them there is no place of escape.

**36** (36) So whatever thing you have been given - it is but [for] enjoyment of the worldly life. But what is with All?h is better and more lasting for those who have believed and upon their Lord rely

**37** (37) And those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive,

**38** (38) And those who have responded to their Lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend,

**39** (39) And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they retaliate [in a just manner].[1425]

**4** (4) To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.[1406]

**40** (40) And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from All?h. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers.

**41** (41) And whoever retaliates after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame].

**42** (42) The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment.

**43** (43) And whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of resolve.[1426]

**44** (44) And he whom All?h sends astray - for him there is no protector beyond Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there for return [to the former world] any way?"

**45** (45) And you will see them being exposed to it [i.e., the Fire], humbled from humiliation, looking from [behind] a covert glance. And those who had believed will say, "Indeed, the [true] losers are the ones who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring punishment."

**46** (46) And there will not be for them any allies to aid them other than All?h. And whoever All?h sends astray - for him there is no way.

**47** (47) Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from All?h of which there is no repelling. No refuge will you have that Day, nor for you will there be any denial.[1427]

**48** (48) But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Mu?ammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.

**49** (49) To All?h belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.

**5** (5) The heavens almost break from above them,[1407] and the angels exalt [All?h] with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is All?h who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

**50** (50) Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.

**51** (51) And it is not for any human being that All?h should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger [i.e., angel] to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.

**52** (52) And thus We have revealed to you an inspiration of Our command [i.e., the Qur�?n]. You did not know what is the Book or [what is] faith, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, [O Mu?ammad], you guide to a straight path -

**53** (53) The path of All?h, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to All?h do [all] matters evolve [i.e., return].

**6** (6) And those who take as allies other than Him - All?h is [yet] Guardian over them; and you, [O Mu?ammad], are not over them a manager -

**7** (7) And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur�?n that you may warn the Mother of Cities [i.e., Makkah] and those around it[1408] and warn of the Day of Assembly, about which there is no doubt. A party will be in Paradise and a party in the Blaze.

**8** (8) And if All?h willed, He could have made them [of] one religion, but He admits whom He wills[1409] into His mercy. And the wrongdoers have not any protector or helper.

**9** (9) Or have they taken protectors [or allies] besides Him? But All?h - He is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.

title: Surah 043 - The Ornaments of Gold (Az-Zukhruf)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.[1429]

**10** (10) [The one] who has made for you the earth a bed and made for you upon it roads that you might be guided

**11** (11) And who sends down rain from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land - thus will you be brought forth -

**12** (12) And who created the species, all of them, and has made for you of ships and animals those which you mount

**13** (13) That you may settle yourselves upon their backs and then remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled upon them and say, "Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have [otherwise] subdued it.[1433]

**14** (14) And indeed we, to our Lord, will [surely] return."

**15** (15) But they have attributed to Him from His servants a portion.[1434] Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful.

**16** (16) Or has He taken, out of what He has created, daughters and chosen you for [having] sons?

**17** (17) And when one of them is given good tidings of that which he attributes to the Most Merciful in comparison [i.e., a daughter], his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

**18** (18) So is one brought up in ornaments while being during conflict unevident[1435] [attributed to All?h]?

**19** (19) And they described the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, as females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.

**2** (2) By the clear Book,

**20** (20) And they said, "If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them." They have of that no knowledge. They are not but misjudging.

**21** (21) Or have We given them a book before it [i.e., the Qur�?n] to which they are adhering?

**22** (22) Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are in their footsteps [rightly] guided."

**23** (23) And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following."

**24** (24) [Each warner] said, "Even if I brought you better guidance than that [religion] upon which you found your fathers?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."

**25** (25) So We took retribution from them; then see how was the end of the deniers.

**26** (26) And [mention, O Mu?ammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship

**27** (27) Except for He who created me; and indeed, He will guide me."

**28** (28) And he made it[1436] a word remaining among his descendants that they might return [to it].

**29** (29) However, I gave enjoyment to these [people of Makkah] and their fathers[1437] until there came to them the truth and a clear Messenger.[1438]

**3** (3) Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur�?n that you might understand.

**30** (30) But when the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic, and indeed we are, concerning it, disbelievers."

**31** (31) And they said, "Why was this Qur�?n not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?"[1439]

**32** (32) Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] that they may make use of one another for service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate.

**33** (33) And if it were not that the people would become one community [of disbelievers],[1440] We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful - for their houses - ceilings and stairways of silver upon which to mount.

**34** (34) And for their houses - doors and couches [of silver] upon which to recline

**35** (35) And gold ornament. But all that is not but the enjoyment of worldly life. And the Hereafter with your Lord is for the righteous.

**36** (36) And whoever is blinded from remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion.

**37** (37) And indeed, they [i.e., the devils] avert them from the way [of guidance] while they think that they are [rightly] guided

**38** (38) Until, when he comes to Us [at Judgement], he says [to his companion], "How I wish there was between me and you the distance between the east and west; and what a wretched companion."

**39** (39) And never will it benefit you that Day, when you have wronged, that you are [all] sharing in the punishment.

**4** (4) And indeed it is, in the Mother of the Book[1430] with Us, exalted and full of wisdom.[1431]

**40** (40) Then will you make the deaf hear, [O Mu?ammad], or guide the blind or he who is in clear error?

**41** (41) And whether [or not] We take you away [in death], indeed, We will take retribution upon them.

**42** (42) Or whether [or not] We show you that which We have promised them, indeed, We are Perfect in Ability.

**43** (43) So adhere to that which is revealed to you. Indeed, you are on a straight path.

**44** (44) And indeed, it is a remembrance[1441] for you and your people, and you [all] are going to be questioned.

**45** (45) And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers; have We made besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?

**46** (46) And certainly did We send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, "Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds."

**47** (47) But when he brought them Our signs, at once they laughed at them.

**48** (48) And We showed them not a sign except that it was greater than its sister, and We seized them with affliction that perhaps they might return [to faith].

**49** (49) And they said [to Moses], "O magician, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. Indeed, we will be guided."

**5** (5) Then should We turn the message away, disregarding you, because you are a transgressing people?

**50** (50) But when We removed from them the affliction, at once they broke their word.

**51** (51) And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?

**52** (52) Or am I [not] better than this one [i.e., Moses] who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?[1442]

**53** (53) Then why have there not been placed upon him bracelets of gold or come with him the angels in conjunction?"

**54** (54) So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of All?h].

**55** (55) And when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all.

**56** (56) And We made them a precedent and an example for the later peoples.

**57** (57) And when the son of Mary was presented as an example,[1443] immediately your people laughed aloud.

**58** (58) And they said, "Are our gods better, or is he?"[1444] They did not present it [i.e., the comparison] except for [mere] argument. But, [in fact], they are a people prone to dispute.

**59** (59) He [i.e., Jesus] was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.

**6** (6) And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples,

**60** (60) And if We willed, We could have made [instead] of you angels succeeding [one another][1445] on the earth.

**61** (61) And indeed, he [i.e., Jesus] will be [a sign for] knowledge of the Hour, so be not in doubt of it, and follow Me.[1446] This is a straight path.

**62** (62) And never let Satan avert you. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

**63** (63) And when Jesus brought clear proofs, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom [i.e., prophethood] and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ, so fear All?h and obey me.

**64** (64) Indeed, All?h is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path."

**65** (65) But the denominations from among them differed [and separated], so woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful Day.

**66** (66) Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?

**67** (67) Close friends, that Day, will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous

**68** (68) [To whom All?h will say], "O My servants, no fear will there be concerning you this Day, nor will you grieve,

**69** (69) [You] who believed in Our verses and were Muslims.

**7** (7) But there would not come to them a prophet except that they used to ridicule him.

**70** (70) Enter Paradise, you and your kinds,[1447] delighted."

**71** (71) Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and [what] delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.

**72** (72) And that is Paradise which you are made to inherit for what you used to do.

**73** (73) For you therein is much fruit[1448] from which you will eat.

**74** (74) Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.

**75** (75) It will not be allowed to subside for them, and they, therein, are in despair.

**76** (76) And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.

**77** (77) And they will call, "O M?lik,[1449] let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."

**78** (78) We had certainly brought you the truth, but most of you, to the truth, were averse.

**79** (79) Or have they devised [some] affair?[1450] But indeed, We are devising [a plan].

**8** (8) And We destroyed greater than them[1432] in [striking] power, and the example of the former peoples has preceded.

**80** (80) Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, [We do], and Our messengers [i.e., angels] are with them recording.

**81** (81) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "If the Most Merciful had a son, then I would be the first of [his] worshippers."[1451]

**82** (82) Exalted is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

**83** (83) So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised.

**84** (84) And it is He [i.e., All?h] who is [the only] deity in the heaven, and on the earth [the only] deity. And He is the Wise, the Knowing.

**85** (85) And blessed is He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them and with whom is knowledge of the Hour and to whom you will be returned.

**86** (86) And those they invoke[1452] besides Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the truth [can benefit], and they know.[1453]

**87** (87) And if you asked them[1454] who created them, they would surely say, "All?h." So how are they deluded?

**88** (88) And [All?h acknowledges] his saying,[1455] "O my Lord, indeed these are a people who do not believe."

**89** (89) So turn aside from them and say, "Peace."[1456] But they are going to know.

**9** (9) And if you should ask them, "Who has created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "They were created by the Exalted in Might, the Knowing,"

title: Surah 044 - The Smoke (Ad-Dukhan)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.[1458]

**10** (10) Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke

**11** (11) Covering the people; this is a painful torment.

**12** (12) [They will say], "Our Lord, remove from us the torment; indeed, we are believers."

**13** (13) How will there be for them a reminder [at that time]? And there had come to them a clear Messenger.

**14** (14) Then they turned away from him and said, "[He was] taught [and is] a madman."

**15** (15) Indeed, We will remove the torment for a little. Indeed, you [disbelievers] will return [to disbelief].

**16** (16) The Day We will strike with the greatest assault, indeed, We will take retribution.

**17** (17) And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger [i.e., Moses],

**18** (18) [Saying], "Render to me the servants of All?h.[1461] Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger,"

**19** (19) And [saying], "Be not haughty with All?h. Indeed, I have come to you with clear evidence.

**2** (2) By the clear Book,

**20** (20) And indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.[1462]

**21** (21) But if you do not believe me, then leave me alone."

**22** (22) And [finally] he called to his Lord that these were a criminal people.

**23** (23) [All?h said], "Then set out with My servants by night. Indeed, you are to be pursued.

**24** (24) And leave the sea in stillness.[1463] Indeed, they are an army to be drowned."

**25** (25) How much they left behind of gardens and springs

**26** (26) And crops and noble sites

**27** (27) And comfort wherein they were amused.

**28** (28) Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.

**29** (29) And the heaven and earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.

**3** (3) Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night.[1459] Indeed, We were to warn [mankind].

**30** (30) And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment -

**31** (31) From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.

**32** (32) And We certainly chose them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.

**33** (33) And We gave them of signs that in which there was a clear trial.

**34** (34) Indeed, these [disbelievers] are saying,

**35** (35) "There is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.

**36** (36) Then bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."

**37** (37) Are they better or the people of Tubba?[1464] and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] indeed, they were criminals.

**38** (38) And We did not create the heavens and earth and that between them in play.

**39** (39) We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.

**4** (4) Therein [i.e., on that night] is made distinct[1460] every precise matter -

**40** (40) Indeed, the Day of Judgement is the appointed time for them all -

**41** (41) The Day when no relation[1465] will avail a relation at all, nor will they be helped -

**42** (42) Except those [believers] on whom All?h has mercy. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

**43** (43) Indeed, the tree of zaqq?m

**44** (44) Is food for the sinful.

**45** (45) Like murky oil, it boils within bellies

**46** (46) Like the boiling of scalding water.

**47** (47) [It will be commanded], "Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Hellfire,

**48** (48) Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water."

**49** (49) [It will be said], "Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble![1466]

**5** (5) [Every] matter [proceeding] from Us. Indeed, We were to send [a messenger]

**50** (50) Indeed, this is what you used to dispute."

**51** (51) Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place:

**52** (52) Within gardens and springs,

**53** (53) Wearing [garments of] fine silk and brocade, facing each other.

**54** (54) Thus. And We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

**55** (55) They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit - safe and secure.

**56** (56) They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire

**57** (57) As bounty from your Lord. That is what is the great attainment.

**58** (58) And indeed, We have eased it [i.e., the Qur�?n] in your tongue that they might be reminded.

**59** (59) So watch, [O Mu?ammad]; indeed, they are watching [for your end].

**6** (6) As mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing,

**7** (7) Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them, if you would be certain.

**8** (8) There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death. [He is] your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.

**9** (9) But they are in doubt, amusing themselves.

title: Surah 045 - The Crouching (Al-Jathiyah)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.[1468]

**10** (10) Before them[1469] is Hell, and what they had earned will not avail them at all nor what they had taken besides All?h as allies. And they will have a great punishment.

**11** (11) This [Qur�?n] is guidance. And those who have disbelieved in the verses of their Lord will have a painful punishment of foul nature.

**12** (12) It is All?h who subjected to you the sea so that ships may sail upon it by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

**13** (13) And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

**14** (14) Say, [O Mu?ammad], to those who have believed that they [should] forgive those who expect not the days of All?h [i.e., of His retribution] so that He may recompense a people[1470] for what they used to earn.

**15** (15) Whoever does a good deed - it is for himself; and whoever does evil - it is against it [i.e., the self or soul]. Then to your Lord you will be returned.

**16** (16) And We did certainly give the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgement[1471] and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and preferred them over the worlds.

**17** (17) And We gave them clear proofs of the matter [of religion]. And they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

**18** (18) Then We put you, [O Mu?ammad], on an ordained way concerning the matter [of religion]; so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.

**19** (19) Indeed, they will never avail you against All?h at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but All?h is the protector of the righteous.

**2** (2) The revelation of the Book is from All?h, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**20** (20) This [Qur�?n] is enlightenment for mankind and guidance and mercy for a people who are certain [in faith].

**21** (21) Or do those who commit evils think We will make them like those who have believed and done righteous deeds - [make them] equal in their life and their death?[1472] Evil is that which they judge [i.e., assume].

**22** (22) And All?h created the heavens and earth in truth and so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

**23** (23) Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and All?h has sent him astray due to knowledge[1473] and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? So who will guide him after All?h? Then will you not be reminded?

**24** (24) And they say, "There is not but our worldly life; we die and live,[1474] and nothing destroys us except time." And they have of that no knowledge; they are only assuming.

**25** (25) And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, their argument is only that they say, "Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."

**26** (26) Say, "All?h causes you to live, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, but most of the people do not know."

**27** (27) And to All?h belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And the Day the Hour appears - that Day the falsifiers will lose.

**28** (28) And you will see every nation kneeling [from fear]. Every nation will be called to its record [and told], "Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.

**29** (29) This, Our record, speaks about you in truth. Indeed, We were having transcribed[1475] whatever you used to do."

**3** (3) Indeed, within the heavens and earth are signs for the believers.

**30** (30) So as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is what is the clear attainment.

**31** (31) But as for those who disbelieved, [it will be said], "Were not Our verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a criminal people?

**32** (32) And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of All?h is truth and the Hour [is coming] - no doubt about it,' you said, 'We know not what is the Hour. We assume only assumption, and we are not convinced.'"

**33** (33) And the evil consequences of what they did will appear to them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

**34** (34) And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.

**35** (35) That is because you took the verses of All?h in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So that Day they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to appease [All?h].

**36** (36) Then, to All?h belongs [all] praise - Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.

**37** (37) And to Him belongs [all] grandeur within the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**4** (4) And in the creation of yourselves and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for people who are certain [in faith].

**5** (5) And [in] the alternation of night and day and [in] what All?h sends down from the sky of provision [i.e., rain] and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and [in His] directing of the winds are signs for a people who reason.

**6** (6) These are the verses of All?h which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after All?h and His verses will they believe?

**7** (7) Woe to every sinful liar

**8** (8) Who hears the verses of All?h recited to him, then persists arrogantly as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

**9** (9) And when he knows anything of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

title: Surah 046 - The Wind-Curved Sandhills (Al-Ahqaf)
content:
**1** (1) ??, Meem.[1477]

**10** (10) Say, "Have you considered: if it [i.e., the Qur�?n] was from All?h, and you disbelieved in it while a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to something similar[1480] and believed while you were arrogant...?"[1481] Indeed, All?h does not guide the wrongdoing people.

**11** (11) And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient falsehood."

**12** (12) And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.

**13** (13) Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is All?h," and then remained on a right course - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

**14** (14) Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.

**15** (15) And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship, and his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months. [He grows] until, when he reaches maturity and reaches [the age of] forty years, he says, "My Lord, enable me[1482] to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to work righteousness of which You will approve and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims."

**16** (16) Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their misdeeds, [their being] among the companions of Paradise. [That is] the promise of truth which they had been promised.

**17** (17) But one who says to his parents, "Uff[1483] to you; do you promise me that I will be brought forth [from the earth] when generations before me have already passed on [into oblivion]?" while they call to All?h for help [and to their son], "Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of All?h is truth." But he says, "This is not but legends of the former peoples" -

**18** (18) Those are the ones upon whom the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect, [who will be] among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.

**19** (19) And for all there are degrees [of reward and punishment] for what they have done, and [it is] so that He may fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.

**2** (2) The revelation of the Book is from All?h, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**20** (20) And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you were defiantly disobedient."

**21** (21) And mention, [O Mu?ammad], the brother of ?Aad,[1484] when he warned his people in [the region of] al-A?q?f - and warners had already passed on before him and after him - [saying], "Do not worship except All?h. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."[1485]

**22** (22) They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."

**23** (23) He said, "Knowledge [of its time] is only with All?h, and I convey to you that with which I was sent; but I see you [to be] a people behaving ignorantly."

**24** (24) And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, "This is a cloud bringing us rain!" Rather, it is that for which you were impatient:[1486] a wind, within it a painful punishment,

**25** (25) Destroying everything by command of its Lord. And they became so that nothing was seen [of them] except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.

**26** (26) And We had certainly established them in such as We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]. But their hearing and vision and hearts availed them not from anything [of the punishment] when they were [continually] rejecting the signs of All?h; and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

**27** (27) And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs [or verses] that perhaps they might return [from disbelief].

**28** (28) Then why did those they took besides All?h as deities by which to approach [Him][1487] not aid them? But they had strayed [i.e., departed] from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.

**29** (29) And [mention, O Mu?ammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur�?n. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen attentively." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.

**3** (3) We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between them except in truth and [for] a specified term. But those who disbelieve, from that of which they are warned, are turning away.

**30** (30) They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a [recited] Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it which guides to the truth and to a straight path.

**31** (31) O our people, respond to the Caller [i.e., Messenger] of All?h[1488] and believe in him; He [i.e., All?h] will forgive for you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.

**32** (32) But he who does not respond to the Caller of All?h will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error."

**33** (33) Do they not see that All?h, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

**34** (34) And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment for what you used to deny."[1489]

**35** (35) So be patient, [O Mu?ammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them.[1490] It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

**4** (4) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Have you considered that which you invoke besides All?h? Show me what they have created of the earth; or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens? Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this or a [remaining] trace of knowledge, if you should be truthful."

**5** (5) And who is more astray than he who invokes besides All?h those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection [i.e., never], and they, of their invocation, are unaware.

**6** (6) And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.

**7** (7) And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic."

**8** (8) Or do they say, "He has invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from All?h at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved.[1478] Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

**9** (9) Say, "I am not something new among the messengers,[1479] nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."

title: Surah 047 - Muhammad (Muhammad)
content:
**1** (1) Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of All?h - He will waste their deeds.[1492]

**10** (10) Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? All?h destroyed [everything] over them,[1497] and for the disbelievers is something comparable.

**11** (11) That is because All?h is the protector of those who have believed and because the disbelievers have no protector.

**12** (12) Indeed, All?h will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.

**13** (13) And how many a city was stronger than your city [i.e., Makkah] which drove you out? We destroyed them; and there was no helper for them.

**14** (14) So is he who is on clear evidence from his Lord like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive and they follow their [own] desires?

**15** (15) Is the description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, wherein are rivers of water unaltered,[1498] rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey, in which they will have from all [kinds of] fruits and forgiveness from their Lord... [Are its inhabitants] like those who abide eternally in the Fire and are given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines?

**16** (16) And among them, [O Mu?ammad], are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge,[1499] "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones of whom All?h has sealed over their hearts and who have followed their [own] desires.

**17** (17) And those who are guided - He increases them in guidance and gives them their righteousness.[1500]

**18** (18) Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then how [i.e., what good] to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?

**19** (19) So know, [O Mu?ammad], that there is no deity except All?h and ask forgiveness for your sin[1501] and for the believing men and believing women. And All?h knows of your movement and your resting place.

**2** (2) And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Mu?ammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.

**20** (20) Those who believe say, "Why has a s?rah[1502] not been sent down?" But when a precise s?rah is revealed and battle is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them[1503] [would have been]

**21** (21) Obedience and good words. And when the matter [of fighting] was determined, if they had been true to All?h, it would have been better for them.

**22** (22) So would you perhaps, if you turned away,[1504] cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship?

**23** (23) Those [who do so] are the ones that All?h has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.

**24** (24) Then do they not reflect upon the Qur�?n, or are there locks upon [their] hearts?

**25** (25) Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.

**26** (26) That is because they said to those who disliked what All?h sent down,[1505] "We will obey you in part of the matter." And All?h knows what they conceal.

**27** (27) Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?

**28** (28) That is because they followed what angered All?h and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

**29** (29) Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that All?h would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?

**3** (3) That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does All?h present to the people their comparisons.[1493]

**30** (30) And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And All?h knows your deeds.

**31** (31) And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of All?h] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.

**32** (32) Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of All?h and opposed the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them - never will they harm All?h at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.

**33** (33) O you who have believed, obey All?h and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.

**34** (34) Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of All?h and then died while they were disbelievers - never will All?h forgive them.

**35** (35) So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and All?h is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.

**36** (36) [This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion. And if you believe and fear All?h, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.

**37** (37) If He should ask you for them and press you, you would withhold, and He would expose your hatred [i.e., unwillingness].

**38** (38) Here you are - those invited to spend in the cause of All?h - but among you are those who withhold [out of greed]. And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself; and All?h is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away [i.e., refuse], He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.

**4** (4) So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure [their] bonds,[1494] and either [confer] favor[1495] afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens.[1496] That [is the command]. And if All?h had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of All?h - never will He waste their deeds.

**5** (5) He will guide them and amend their condition

**6** (6) And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.

**7** (7) O you who have believed, if you support All?h, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.

**8** (8) But those who disbelieve - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.

**9** (9) That is because they disliked what All?h revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

title: Surah 048 - The Victory (Al-Fath)
content:
**1** (1) Indeed, We have given you, [O Mu?ammad], a clear conquest[1507]

**10** (10) Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Mu?ammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to All?h. The hand[1508] of All?h is over their hands.[1509] So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised All?h - He will give him a great reward.

**11** (11) Those who remained behind[1510] of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts. Say, "Then who could prevent All?h at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is All?h, of what you do, Aware.

**12** (12) But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."

**13** (13) And whoever has not believed in All?h and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.

**14** (14) And to All?h belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is All?h Forgiving and Merciful.

**15** (15) Those who remained[1511] behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of All?h. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did All?h say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.[1512]

**16** (16) Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit.[1513] So if you obey, All?h will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

**17** (17) There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys All?h and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.

**18** (18) Certainly was All?h pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Mu?ammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest[1514]

**19** (19) And much war booty which they will take. And ever is All?h Exalted in Might and Wise.

**2** (2) That All?h may forgive for you what preceded of your sin [i.e., errors] and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path

**20** (20) All?h has promised you much booty that you will take [in the future] and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.

**21** (21) And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which All?h has already encompassed.[1515] And ever is All?h, over all things, competent.

**22** (22) And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.

**23** (23) [This is] the established way of All?h which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of All?h any change.

**24** (24) And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is All?h, of what you do, Seeing.

**25** (25) They are the ones who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-?ar?m while the offering[1516] was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample [i.e., kill] them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that All?h might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment

**26** (26) When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But All?h sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is All?h, of all things, Knowing.

**27** (27) Certainly has All?h showed to His Messenger the vision [i.e., dream] in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-?ar?m, if All?h wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened,[1517] not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].

**28** (28) It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is All?h as Witness.

**29** (29) Mu?ammad is the Messenger of All?h; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from All?h and [His] pleasure. Their sign is in their faces from the effect of prostration [i.e., prayer]. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that He [i.e., All?h] may enrage by them[1518] the disbelievers. All?h has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.

**3** (3) And [that] All?h may aid you with a mighty victory.

**4** (4) It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to All?h belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is All?h Knowing and Wise.

**5** (5) [And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of All?h, a great attainment �

**6** (6) And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about All?h an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature; and All?h has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.

**7** (7) And to All?h belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is All?h Exalted in Might and Wise.

**8** (8) Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner
