title: Surah 049 - The Rooms (Al-Hujurat)
content:
**1** (1) O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before All?h and His Messenger[1520] but fear All?h. Indeed, All?h is Hearing and Knowing.

**10** (10) The believers are but brothers, so make settlement between your brothers. And fear All?h that you may receive mercy.

**11** (11) O you who have believed, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name [i.e., mention] of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

**12** (12) O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear All?h; indeed, All?h is Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

**13** (13) O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of All?h is the most righteous[1521] of you. Indeed, All?h is Knowing and Aware.

**14** (14) The bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not [yet] believed; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey All?h and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds[1522] of anything. Indeed, All?h is Forgiving and Merciful."

**15** (15) The believers are only the ones who have believed in All?h and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of All?h. It is those who are the truthful.

**16** (16) Say, "Would you acquaint All?h with your religion while All?h knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and All?h is Knowing of all things?"

**17** (17) They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Isl?m. Say, "Do not consider your Isl?m a favor to me. Rather, All?h has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if you should be truthful."

**18** (18) Indeed, All?h knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And All?h is Seeing of what you do.

**2** (2) O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.

**3** (3) Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of All?h - they are the ones whose hearts All?h has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and great reward.

**4** (4) Indeed, those who call you, [O Mu?ammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.

**5** (5) And if they had been patient until you [could] come out to them, it would have been better for them. But All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**6** (6) O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.

**7** (7) And know that among you is the Messenger of All?h. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be in difficulty, but All?h has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.

**8** (8) [It is] as bounty from All?h and favor. And All?h is Knowing and Wise.

**9** (9) And if two factions among the believers should fight, then make settlement between the two. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of All?h. And if it returns, then make settlement between them in justice and act justly. Indeed, All?h loves those who act justly.

content:

**10** (10) And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

**40** (40) And We have certainly made the Qur�?n easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

**41** (41) And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.

**42** (42) They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.

**43** (43) Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scriptures?

**44** (44) Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?

**45** (45) [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].[1587]

**46** (46) But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.

**47** (47) Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.[1588].

**48** (48) The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."[1589]

**49** (49) Indeed, all things We created with predestination.

**5** (5) Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].

**50** (50) And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.

**51** (51) And We have already destroyed your kinds,[1590] so is there any who will remember?

**52** (52) And everything they did is in written records.

**53** (53) And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.

**54** (54) Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,

**55** (55) In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.[1591]

**6** (6) So leave them, [O Mu?ammad]. The Day the Caller[1579] calls to something forbidding,

**7** (7) Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,

**8** (8) Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."

**9** (9) The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.

title: Surah 055 - The Beneficent (Ar-Rahman)
content:
**1** (1) The Most Merciful

**10** (10) And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.

**11** (11) Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]

**12** (12) And grain having husks and scented plants.

**13** (13) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?[1594]

**14** (14) He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.

**15** (15) And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.

**16** (16) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**17** (17) [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.[1595]

**18** (18) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**19** (19) He released the two seas,[1596] meeting [one another];

**2** (2) Taught the Qur�?n,

**20** (20) Between them is a barrier so neither of them transgresses.

**21** (21) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**22** (22) From both of them emerge pearl and coral.

**23** (23) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**24** (24) And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.

**25** (25) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**26** (26) Everyone upon it [i.e., the earth] will perish,

**27** (27) And there will remain the Face[1597] of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

**28** (28) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**29** (29) Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is in [i.e., bringing about] a matter.[1598]

**3** (3) Created man,

**30** (30) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**31** (31) We will attend to you, O prominent beings.[1599]

**32** (32) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**33** (33) O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from All?h].

**34** (34) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**35** (35) There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke,[1600] and you will not defend yourselves.

**36** (36) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**37** (37) And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil[1601] -

**38** (38) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**39** (39) Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.[1602]

**4** (4) [And] taught him eloquence.

**40** (40) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**41** (41) The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.

**42** (42) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**43** (43) This is Hell, which the criminals deny.

**44** (44) They will circulate between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].

**45** (45) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**46** (46) But for he who has feared the position of his Lord[1603] are two gardens -

**47** (47) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**48** (48) Having [spreading] branches.

**49** (49) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**5** (5) The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,

**50** (50) In both of them are two springs, flowing.

**51** (51) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**52** (52) In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.

**53** (53) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**54** (54) [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.

**55** (55) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**56** (56) In them are women limiting [their] glances,[1604] untouched[1605] before them by man or jinn? -

**57** (57) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**58** (58) As if they were rubies and coral.[1606]

**59** (59) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**6** (6) And the stars and trees prostrate.[1593]

**60** (60) Is the reward for good [anything] but good?

**61** (61) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**62** (62) And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -

**63** (63) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**64** (64) Dark green [in color].

**65** (65) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**66** (66) In both of them are two springs, spouting.

**67** (67) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**68** (68) In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.

**69** (69) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**7** (7) And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance

**70** (70) In them are good and beautiful women -

**71** (71) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**72** (72) Fair ones reserved in pavilions -

**73** (73) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**74** (74) Untouched before them by man or jinn? -

**75** (75) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

**76** (76) Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.

**77** (77) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

**78** (78) Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

**8** (8) That you not transgress within the balance.

**9** (9) And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.

title: Surah 056 - The Inevitable (Al-Waqi'ah)
content:
**1** (1) When the Occurrence occurs,

**10** (10) And the forerunners, the forerunners[1611] -

**11** (11) Those are the ones brought near [to All?h]

**12** (12) In the Gardens of Pleasure,

**13** (13) A [large] company of the former peoples

**14** (14) And a few of the later peoples,

**15** (15) On thrones woven [with ornament],

**16** (16) Reclining on them, facing each other.

**17** (17) There will circulate among them young boys made eternal

**18** (18) With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -

**19** (19) No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -

**2** (2) There is, at its occurrence, no denial.

**20** (20) And fruit of what they select

**21** (21) And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.

**22** (22) And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,

**23** (23) The likenesses of pearls well-protected,

**24** (24) As reward for what they used to do.

**25** (25) They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -

**26** (26) Only a saying [of] peace, peace.

**27** (27) The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?

**28** (28) [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed

**29** (29) And [banana] trees layered [with fruit]

**3** (3) It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].[1608]

**30** (30) And shade extended

**31** (31) And water poured out

**32** (32) And fruit, abundant [and varied],

**33** (33) Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden,

**34** (34) And [upon] beds raised high.

**35** (35) Indeed, We have produced them [i.e., the women of Paradise] in a [new] creation

**36** (36) And made them virgins,

**37** (37) Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,

**38** (38) For the companions of the right [who are]

**39** (39) A company of the former peoples

**4** (4) When the earth is shaken with convulsion

**40** (40) And a company of the later peoples.

**41** (41) And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?

**42** (42) [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water

**43** (43) And a shade of black smoke,

**44** (44) Neither cool nor beneficial.

**45** (45) Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,

**46** (46) And they used to persist in the great violation,[1612]

**47** (47) And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

**48** (48) And our forefathers [as well]?"

**49** (49) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Indeed, the former and later peoples

**5** (5) And the mountains are broken down, crumbling

**50** (50) Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."

**51** (51) Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,

**52** (52) Will be eating from trees of zaqq?m

**53** (53) And filling with it your bellies

**54** (54) And drinking on top of it from scalding water

**55** (55) And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.

**56** (56) That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.

**57** (57) We have created you, so why do you not believe?

**58** (58) Have you seen that which you emit?[1613]

**59** (59) Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?

**6** (6) And become dust dispersing,

**60** (60) We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone

**61** (61) In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.[1614]

**62** (62) And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?

**63** (63) And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?

**64** (64) Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?

**65** (65) If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,[1615]

**66** (66) [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;

**67** (67) Rather, we have been deprived."

**68** (68) And have you seen the water that you drink?

**69** (69) Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?

**7** (7) And you become [of] three kinds:

**70** (70) If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?

**71** (71) And have you seen the fire that you ignite?

**72** (72) Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?

**73** (73) We have made it a reminder[1616] and provision for the travelers,[1617]

**74** (74) So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

**75** (75) Then I swear by the setting of the stars,[1618]

**76** (76) And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.

**77** (77) Indeed, it is a noble Qur�?n.

**78** (78) In a Register well-protected;[1619].

**79** (79) None touch it except the purified [i.e., the angels].

**8** (8) Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?[1609]

**80** (80) [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

**81** (81) Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent

**82** (82) And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?

**83** (83) Then why, when it [i.e., the soul at death] reaches the throat

**84** (84) And you are at that time looking on -

**85** (85) And We [i.e., Our angels] are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -

**86** (86) Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,

**87** (87) Bring it back,[1620] if you should be truthful?

**88** (88) And if he [i.e., the deceased] was of those brought near [to All?h],

**89** (89) Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.

**9** (9) And the companions of the left - what are companions of the left?[1610]

**90** (90) And if he was of the companions of the right,

**91** (91) Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."

**92** (92) But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,

**93** (93) Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water

**94** (94) And burning in Hellfire.

**95** (95) Indeed, this is the true certainty,

**96** (96) So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

title: Surah 057 - The Iron (Al-Hadid)
content:
**1** (1) Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts All?h,[1622] and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**10** (10) And why do you not spend in the cause of All?h while to All?h belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all All?h has promised the best [reward]. And All?h, of what you do, is Aware.

**11** (11) Who is it that would loan All?h a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?

**12** (12) On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.

**13** (13) On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you[1630] and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.

**14** (14) They [i.e., the hypocrites] will call to them [i.e., the believers], "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves[1631] and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of All?h. And the Deceiver [i.e., Satan] deceived you concerning All?h.

**15** (15) So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination."

**16** (16) Has the time not come for those who have believed that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of All?h and what has come down of the truth? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.

**17** (17) Know that All?h gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. We have made clear to you the signs; perhaps you will understand.[1632]

**18** (18) Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned All?h a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.

**19** (19) And those who have believed in All?h and His messengers - those are [in the ranks of] the supporters of truth and the martyrs, with their Lord. For them is their reward and their light.[1633] But those who have disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of Hellfire.

**2** (2) His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.

**20** (20) Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from All?h and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.

**21** (21) Race [i.e., compete] toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in All?h and His messengers. That is the bounty of All?h which He gives to whom He wills, and All?h is the possessor of great bounty.

**22** (22) No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register[1634] before We bring it into being - indeed that, for All?h, is easy -

**23** (23) In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And All?h does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful -

**24** (24) [Those] who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away[1635] - then indeed, All?h is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

**25** (25) We have already sent Our messengers with clear evidences and sent down with them the Scripture and the balance that the people may maintain [their affairs] in justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that All?h may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, All?h is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

**26** (26) And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

**27** (27) Then We sent following their footsteps [i.e., traditions] Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of All?h. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

**28** (28) O you who have believed, fear All?h and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**29** (29) [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of All?h[1636] and that [all] bounty is in the hand[1637] of All?h; He gives it to whom He wills. And All?h is the possessor of great bounty.

**3** (3) He is the First[1623] and the Last,[1624] the Ascendant[1625] and the Intimate,[1626] and He is, of all things, Knowing.

**4** (4) It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne.[1627] He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you[1628] wherever you are. And All?h, of what you do, is Seeing.

**5** (5) His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to All?h are returned [all] matters.

**6** (6) He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

**7** (7) Believe in All?h and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successive inheritors. For those who have believed among you and spent,[1629] there will be a great reward.

**8** (8) And why do you not believe in All?h while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?

**9** (9) It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Mu?ammad (?)] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, All?h is to you Kind and Merciful.

title: Surah 058 - The Pleading Woman (Al-Mujadila)
content:
**1** (1) Certainly has All?h heard the speech of the one who argues [i.e., pleads] with you, [O Mu?ammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to All?h. And All?h hears your dialogue; indeed, All?h is Hearing and Seeing.

**10** (10) Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have believed,[1644] but he will not harm them at all except by permission of All?h. And upon All?h let the believers rely.

**11** (11) O you who have believed, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; All?h will make space for you.[1645] And when you are told, "Arise,"[1646] then arise; All?h will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And All?h is Aware of what you do.

**12** (12) O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**13** (13) Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and All?h has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zak?h and obey All?h and His Messenger. And All?h is Aware of what you do.

**14** (14) Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom All?h has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].

**15** (15) All?h has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

**16** (16) They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of All?h, and for them is a humiliating punishment.

**17** (17) Never will their wealth or their children avail them against All?h at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally

**18** (18) On the Day All?h will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something.[1647] Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.

**19** (19) Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of All?h. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.

**2** (2) Those who pronounce ?ih?r[1639] among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, All?h is Pardoning and Forgiving.

**20** (20) Indeed, the ones who oppose All?h and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.

**21** (21) All?h has written [i.e., decreed], "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, All?h is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

**22** (22) You will not find a people who believe in All?h and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose All?h and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit[1648] from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. All?h is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of All?h. Unquestionably, the party of All?h - they are the successful.

**3** (3) And those who pronounce ?ih?r from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and All?h is Aware of what you do.

**4** (4) And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively[1640] before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in All?h and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] All?h. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

**5** (5) Indeed, those who oppose All?h and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment

**6** (6) On the Day when All?h will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. All?h had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and All?h is, over all things, Witness.[1641]

**7** (7) Have you not considered that All?h knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There are not three in a private conversation but that He is the fourth of them,[1642] nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed All?h is, of all things, Knowing.

**8** (8) Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation [i.e., ridicule and conspiracy] and then return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which All?h does not greet you[1643] and say among themselves, "Why does All?h not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination.

**9** (9) O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear All?h, to whom you will be gathered.

title: Surah 059 - The Exile (Al-Hashr)
content:
**1** (1) Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts All?h,[1650] and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**10** (10) And [there is a share for] those who come after them, saying, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."

**11** (11) Have you not considered those who practice hypocrisy, saying to their brothers [i.e., associates] who have disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone - ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But All?h testifies that they are liars.

**12** (12) If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.

**13** (13) You [believers] are more fearful within their breasts than All?h. That is because they are a people who do not understand.

**14** (14) They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence [i.e., enmity] among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.

**15** (15) [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

**16** (16) [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieves, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear All?h, Lord of the worlds."

**17** (17) So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.

**18** (18) O you who have believed, fear All?h. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear All?h. Indeed, All?h is Aware of what you do.

**19** (19) And be not like those who forgot All?h, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.

**2** (2) It is He who expelled the ones who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture[1651] from their homes at the first gathering.[1652] You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from All?h; but [the decree of] All?h came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.

**20** (20) Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].

**21** (21) If We had sent down this Qur�?n upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and splitting from fear of All?h. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.

**22** (22) He is All?h, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed.[1657] He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

**23** (23) He is All?h, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign,[1658] the Pure,[1659] the Perfection,[1660] the Grantor of Security,[1661] the Overseer,[1662] the Exalted in Might,[1663] the Compeller,[1664] the Superior.[1665] Exalted is All?h above whatever they associate with Him.

**24** (24) He is All?h, the Creator,[1666] the Producer,[1667] the Fashioner;[1668] to Him belong the best names.[1669] Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.[1670]

**3** (3) And if not that All?h had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in [this] world, and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.

**4** (4) That is because they opposed All?h and His Messenger. And whoever opposes All?h - then indeed, All?h is severe in penalty.

**5** (5) Whatever you have cut down of [their] palm trees or left standing on their trunks - it was by permission of All?h and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.

**6** (6) And what All?h restored [of property] to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it [in an expedition] any horses or camels,[1653] but All?h gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and All?h is over all things competent.

**7** (7) And what All?h restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for All?h and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives[1654] and orphans and the needy and the [stranded] traveler[1655] - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear All?h; indeed, All?h is severe in penalty.

**8** (8) For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from All?h and [His] approval and supporting [the cause of] All?h and His Messenger, [there is also a share]. Those are the truthful.

**9** (9) And [also for] those who were settled in the Home [i.e.,al-Mad?nah] and [adopted] the faith before them.[1656] They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what they [i.e., the emigrants] were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.

title: Surah 060 - She that is to be examined (Al-Mumtahanah)
content:
**1** (1) O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies,[1672] extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in All?h, your Lord. If you have come out for jih?d [i.e., fighting or striving] in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [take them not as friends]. You confide to them affection [i.e., instruction], but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

**10** (10) O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine [i.e., test] them. All?h is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give them [i.e., the disbelievers] what they have spent.[1676] And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation [i.e., mahr]. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them [i.e., the disbelievers] ask for what they have spent.[1677] That is the judgement of All?h; He judges between you. And All?h is Knowing and Wise.

**11** (11) And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and you subsequently obtain [something],[1678] then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear All?h, in whom you are believers.

**12** (12) O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with All?h, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs,[1679] nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of All?h. Indeed, All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**13** (13) O you who have believed, do not make allies of a people with whom All?h has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the companions [i.e., inhabitants] of the graves.

**2** (2) If they gain dominance over you, they would be [i.e., behave] to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.

**3** (3) Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And All?h, of what you do, is Seeing.

**4** (4) There has already been for you an excellent pattern[1673] in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than All?h. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in All?h alone" - except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against All?h. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

**5** (5) Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

**6** (6) There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in All?h and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, All?h is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

**7** (7) Perhaps All?h will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And All?h is competent,[1674] and All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**8** (8) All?h does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, All?h loves those who act justly.

**9** (9) All?h only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies[1675] of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

title: Surah 061 - The Ranks (As-Saf)
content:
**1** (1) Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts All?h,[1681] and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**10** (10) O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?

**11** (11) [It is that] you believe in All?h and His Messenger and strive in the cause of All?h with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you only knew.

**12** (12) He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.

**13** (13) And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from All?h and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers.

**14** (14) O you who have believed, be supporters of All?h, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for All?h?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of All?h." And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.

**2** (2) O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?

**3** (3) Greatly hateful in the sight of All?h is that you say what you do not do.

**4** (4) Indeed, All?h loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.

**5** (5) And [mention, O Mu?ammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of All?h to you?" And when they deviated, All?h caused their hearts to deviate. And All?h does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

**6** (6) And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O Children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of All?h to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is A?mad."[1682] But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."[1683]

**7** (7) And who is more unjust than one who invents about All?h untruth while he is being invited to Isl?m. And All?h does not guide the wrongdoing people.

**8** (8) They want to extinguish the light of All?h with their mouths, but All?h will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.

**9** (9) It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with All?h dislike it.

title: Surah 062 - The Congregation, Friday (Al-Jumu'ah)
content:
**1** (1) Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting All?h,[1685] the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.[1686]

**10** (10) And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of All?h, and remember All?h often that you may succeed.

**11** (11) But [on one occasion] when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Mu?ammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with All?h is better than diversion and than a transaction, and All?h is the best of providers."

**2** (2) It is He who has sent among the unlettered [Arabs] a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book [i.e., the Qur�?n] and wisdom [i.e., the sunnah] - although they were before in clear error -

**3** (3) And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**4** (4) That is the bounty of All?h, which He gives to whom He wills, and All?h is the possessor of great bounty.

**5** (5) The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on[1687] is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books].[1688] Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of All?h. And All?h does not guide the wrongdoing people.

**6** (6) Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of All?h, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."

**7** (7) But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And All?h is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

**8** (8) Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."

**9** (9) O you who have believed, when [the adh?n] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumu?ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of All?h and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.

title: Surah 063 - The Hypocrites (Al-Munafiqun)
content:
**1** (1) When the hypocrites come to you, [O Mu?ammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of All?h." And All?h knows that you are His Messenger, and All?h testifies that the hypocrites are liars.

**10** (10) And spend [in the way of All?h] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be of the righteous."

**11** (11) But never will All?h delay a soul when its time has come. And All?h is Aware of what you do.

**2** (2) They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of All?h. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

**3** (3) That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.

**4** (4) And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up[1690] - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May All?h destroy them; how are they deluded?

**5** (5) And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of All?h will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.

**6** (6) It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will All?h forgive them. Indeed, All?h does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

**7** (7) They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of All?h until they disband." And to All?h belong the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.

**8** (8) They say, "If we return to al-Mad?nah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to All?h belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

**9** (9) O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of All?h. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.

title: Surah 064 - The Mutual Disillusion (At-Taghabun)
content:
**1** (1) Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting All?h.[1692] To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.

**10** (10) But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.

**11** (11) No disaster strikes except by permission of All?h. And whoever believes in All?h - He will guide his heart. And All?h is Knowing of all things.

**12** (12) And obey All?h and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.

**13** (13) All?h - there is no deity except Him. And upon All?h let the believers rely.

**14** (14) O you who have believed, indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**15** (15) Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and All?h has with Him a great reward.

**16** (16) So fear All?h as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of All?h]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.

**17** (17) If you loan All?h a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And All?h is [most] Appreciative[1694] and Forbearing,[1695]

**18** (18) Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

**2** (2) It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And All?h, of what you do, is Seeing.

**3** (3) He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.

**4** (4) He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And All?h is Knowing of that within the breasts.

**5** (5) Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

**6** (6) That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And All?h dispensed [with them]; and All?h is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

**7** (7) Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for All?h, is easy."

**8** (8) So believe in All?h and His Messenger and the light [i.e., the Qur�?n] which We have sent down. And All?h is Aware of what you do.

**9** (9) The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation.[1693] And whoever believes in All?h and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.

title: Surah 065 - The Divorce (At-Talaq)
content:
**1** (1) O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period,[1697] and fear All?h, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] All?h. And whoever transgresses the limits of All?h has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps All?h will bring about after that a [different] matter.[1698]

**10** (10) All?h has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear All?h, O you of understanding who have believed. All?h has sent down to you a message [i.e., the Qur�?n].[1704]

**11** (11) [He sent] a Messenger [i.e., Mu?ammad (?)] reciting to you the distinct verses of All?h that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in All?h and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. All?h will have perfected for him a provision.

**12** (12) It is All?h who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them.[1705] [His] command descends among them so you may know that All?h is over all things competent and that All?h has encompassed all things in knowledge.

**2** (2) And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or part with them according to acceptable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] All?h. That is instructed to whoever should believe in All?h and the Last Day. And whoever fears All?h - He will make for him a way out[1699]

**3** (3) And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon All?h - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, All?h will accomplish His purpose. All?h has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.

**4** (4) And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth.[1700] And whoever fears All?h - He will make for him of his matter ease.

**5** (5) That is the command of All?h, which He has sent down to you; and whoever fears All?h - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.

**6** (6) Lodge them[1701] [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them.[1702] And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for him [i.e., the father] another woman.[1703]

**7** (7) Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what All?h has given him. All?h does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. All?h will bring about, after hardship, ease [i.e., relief].

**8** (8) And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.

**9** (9) And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair [i.e., rebellion], and the outcome of its affair was loss.

title: Surah 066 - The Prohibition (At-Tahrim)
content:
**1** (1) O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what All?h has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And All?h is Forgiving and Merciful.

**10** (10) All?h presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them,[1710] so they [i.e., those prophets] did not avail them from All?h at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."

**11** (11) And All?h presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."

**12** (12) And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of ?Imr?n, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel], and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.

**2** (2) All?h has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths.[1707] And All?h is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.

**3** (3) And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and All?h showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Aware."

**4** (4) If you two [wives] repent to All?h, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed All?h is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.

**5** (5) Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to All?h], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling[1708] - [ones] previously married and virgins.

**6** (6) O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey All?h in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.

**7** (7) O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.

**8** (8) O you who have believed, repent to All?h with sincere repentance. Perhaps[1709] your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when All?h will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."

**9** (9) O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.

title: Surah 067 - The Sovereignty (Al-Mulk)
content:
**1** (1) Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -

**10** (10) And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."

**11** (11) And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation[1715] for the companions of the Blaze.

**12** (12) Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.

**13** (13) And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

**14** (14) Does He who created not know,[1716] while He is the Subtle, the Aware?

**15** (15) It is He who made the earth tame[1717] for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.

**16** (16) Do you feel secure that He who is above[1718] would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?[1719]

**17** (17) Or do you feel secure that He who is above would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.

**18** (18) And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

**19** (19) Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.

**2** (2) [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -

**20** (20) Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.

**21** (21) Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.

**22** (22) Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?

**23** (23) Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful."

**24** (24) Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."

**25** (25) And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

**26** (26) Say, "The knowledge is only with All?h, and I am only a clear warner."

**27** (27) But when they see it[1720] approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."[1721]

**28** (28) Say, [O Mu?ammad], "Have you considered:[1722] whether All?h should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

**29** (29) Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."

**3** (3) [And] who created seven heavens in layers.[1712] You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?

**30** (30) Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"

**4** (4) Then return [your] vision twice again.[1713] [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.

**5** (5) And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars] and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils[1714] and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.

**6** (6) And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.

**7** (7) When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.

**8** (8) It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"

**9** (9) They will say, "Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'All?h has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"

title: Surah 068 - The Pen (Al-Qalam)
content:
**1** (1) N?n.[1724] By the pen and what they inscribe,

**10** (10) And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer

**11** (11) [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -

**12** (12) A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,

**13** (13) Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.[1725]

**14** (14) Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

**15** (15) When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."

**16** (16) We will brand him upon the snout.[1726]

**17** (17) Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning

content:
